macro.name: Common Attribute Set For Code Sequence Attributes (invoked AS “code Sequence Macro”)

entry.name: Code Value
entry.description: See Section 8.1.

entry.name: Coding Scheme Designator
entry.description: See Section 8.2.

entry.name: Coding Scheme Version
entry.description: See Section 8.2. Required if the value of Coding Scheme Designator (0008,0102) is not sufficient to identify the Code Value (0008,0100) unambiguously.

entry.name: Code Meaning
entry.description: See Section 8.3.

entry.name: Context Identifier
entry.description: See Section 8.6.

entry.name: Mapping Resource
entry.description: See Section 8.4. Required if Context Identifier (0008,010F) is present.

entry.name: Context Group Version
entry.description: See Section 8.5. Required if Context Identifier (0008,010F) is present.

entry.name: Context Group Extension Flag
entry.description: Indicates whether the Code Value/Coding Scheme/Code Meaning is selected from a private extension of the Context Group identified in Context Identifier (0008,010F). See Section 8.7 of this Part. Enumerated Values: "Y", "N"

entry.name: Context Group Local Version
entry.description: See Section 8.7. Required if the value of Context Group Extension Flag (0008,010B) is "Y". .

entry.name: Context Group Extension Creator UID
entry.description: Identifies the person or organization who created an extension to the Context Group. See Section 8.7. Required if the value of Context Group Extension Flag (0008,010B) is "Y".

entry.name: Person Identification Code Sequence
entry.description: A coded entry which identifies a person. The Code Meaning attribute, though it will be encoded with a VR of LO, may be encoded according to the rules of the PN VR (e.g. caret ‘^' delimiters shall separate name components), except that a single component (i.e. the whole name unseparated by caret delimiters) is not permitted. Name component groups for use with multi-byte character sets are permitted, as long as they fit within the 64 characters (the length of the LO VR). One or more Items may be permitted in this Sequence.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Person's Address
entry.description: Person's mailing address

entry.name: Person's Telephone Numbers
entry.description: Person's telephone number(s)

entry.name: Institution Name
entry.description: Institution or organization to which the identified individual is responsible or accountable. Required if Institution Code Sequence (0008,0082) is not present.

entry.name: Institution Address
entry.description: Mailing address of the institution or organization to which the identified individual is responsible or accountable.

entry.name: Institution Code Sequence
entry.description: Institution or organization to which the identified individual is responsible or accountable. Required if Institution Name (0008,0080) is not present. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Value Type
entry.description: The type of the value encoded in this name-value Item. Defined Terms: DATETIME DATE TIME PNAME UIDREF TEXT CODE NUMERIC

entry.name: Concept Name Code Sequence
entry.description: Coded concept name of this name-value Item. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: DateTime
entry.description: DateTime value for this name-value Item. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is DATETIME.

entry.name: Date
entry.description: Date value for this name-value Item. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is DATE.

entry.name: Time
entry.description: Time value for this name-value Item. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is TIME.

entry.name: Person Name
entry.description: Person name value for this name-value Item. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is PNAME.

entry.name: UID
entry.description: UID value for this name-value Item. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is UIDREF.

entry.name: Text Value
entry.description: Text value for this name-value Item. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is TEXT.

entry.name: Concept Code Sequence
entry.description: Coded concept value of this name-value Item. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is CODE.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Numeric Value
entry.description: Numeric value for this name-value Item. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is NUMERIC.

entry.name: Measurement Units Code Sequence
entry.description: Units of measurement for a numeric value in this name-value Item. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence. Required if Value Type (0040,A040) is NUMERIC.

include.description: Baseline Context ID 82

macro.name: Image SOP Instance Reference Macro Attributes

entry.name: Referenced Frame Number
entry.description: Identifies the frame numbers within the Referenced SOP Instance to which the reference applies. The first frame shall be denoted as frame number 1. Note: This Attribute may be multi-valued. Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a multi-frame image and the reference does not apply to all frames, and Referenced Segment Number (0062,000B) is not present.

entry.name: Referenced Segment Number
entry.description: Identifies the Segment Number to which the reference applies. Required if the Referenced SOP Instance is a Segmentation and the reference does not apply to all segments and Referenced Frame Number (0008,1160) is not present.

macro.name: Series and Instance Reference Macro Attributes

entry.name: Referenced Series Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items each of which includes the Attributes of one Series. One or more Items shall be present.

entry.name: >Series Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of the Series containing the referenced Instances.

entry.name: >Referenced Instance Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items each providing a reference to an Instance that is part of the Series defined by Series Instance UID (0020,000E) in the enclosing Item. One or more Items shall be present.

entry.name: Anatomic Region Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the anatomic region of interest in this Instance (i.e. external anatomy, surface anatomy, or general region of the body). Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

include.description: Context ID may be defined in the macro invocation.

entry.name: >Anatomic Region Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items that modifies the anatomic region of interest of this Instance One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

include.description: Defined Context ID is 2, unless otherwise defined in the macro invocation.
Context ID may be defined in the macro invocation.

entry.name: Anatomic Region Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the anatomic region of interest in this Instance (i.e. external anatomy, surface anatomy, or general region of the body). Zero or one Item may be present in this Sequence.

include.description: Context ID may be defined in the macro invocation.

entry.name: >Anatomic Region Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items that modifies the anatomic region of interest of this Instance One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

include.description: Defined Context ID is 2, unless otherwise defined in the macro invocation.
Context ID may be defined in the macro invocation.

entry.name: Anatomic Region Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that identifies the anatomic region of interest in this Instance (i.e. external anatomy, surface anatomy, or general region of the body). Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

include.description: Context ID may be defined in the macro invocation.

entry.name: >Anatomic Region Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items that modifies the anatomic region of interest of this Instance One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

include.description: Defined Context ID is 2, unless otherwise defined in the macro invocation.
Context ID may be defined in the macro invocation.

entry.name: Primary Anatomic Structure Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items that identifies the primary anatomic structure(s) of interest in this Instance. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

include.description: Context ID may be defined in the macro invocation.

entry.name: >Primary Anatomic Structure Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items that modifies the primary anatomic structure of interest in this Instance. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

include.description: Defined Context ID is 2.

entry.name: Requested Procedure ID
entry.description: Identifier that identifies the Requested Procedure in the Imaging Service Request. Required if procedure was scheduled. May be present otherwise. Note: The condition is to allow the contents of this macro to be present (e.g., to convey the reason for the procedure, such as whether a mammogram is for screening or diagnostic purposes) even when the procedure was not formally scheduled and a value for this identifier is unknown, rather than making up a dummy value.

entry.name: Accession Number
entry.description: An identifier of the Imaging Service Request for this Requested Procedure.

entry.name: Study Instance UID
entry.description: The unique identifier for the Study provided for this Requested Procedure.

entry.name: Referenced Study Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Study SOP Instances associated with this SOP Instance. One or more items may be included.

entry.name: Requested Procedure Description
entry.description: Institution-generated administrative description or classification of Requested Procedure.

entry.name: Requested Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that conveys the Procedure Type of the requested procedure. The Requested Procedure Code Sequence shall contain only a single item.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Reason for the Requested Procedure
entry.description: Reason for requesting this procedure.

entry.name: Reason for Requested Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: Coded Reason for requesting this procedure. One or more sequence items may be present.

include.description: Context ID may be defined in the macro invocation.

entry.name: Scheduled Procedure Step ID
entry.description: Identifier that identifies the Scheduled Procedure Step. Required if procedure was scheduled. Note: The condition is to allow the contents of this macro to be present (e.g., to convey the reason for the procedure, such as whether a mammogram is for screening or diagnostic purposes) even when the procedure step was not formally scheduled and a value for this identifier is unknown, rather than making up a dummy value.

entry.name: Scheduled Procedure Step Description
entry.description: Institution-generated description or classification of the Scheduled Procedure Step to be performed.

entry.name: Scheduled Protocol Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence describing the Scheduled Protocol following a specific coding scheme. This sequence contains one or more Items.

include.description: Context ID may be defined in the macro invocation.

entry.name: >Protocol Context Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies the context for the Scheduled Protocol Code Sequence Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

include.description: Context ID may be defined in the macro invocation.

entry.name: >> Content Item Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies modifiers for a Protocol Context Content Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See Section C.4.10.1.
entry.section: The Protocol Context Sequence (0040,0440) allows the specification of parameters that further qualify the scheduled protocol, provided through a set of generic name/value pairs of context Content Items. Note: This allows the specification of clinical, acquisition, or procedural qualifiers for the scheduled protocol, such as a specific body part, imaging technique, or parameters of a preparatory event (e.g., radionuclide injection). Specific uses of this Sequence may be documented in a Template defined in accordance with PS3.16.

include.description: Context ID may be defined in the macro invocation.

macro.name: Basic Pixel Spacing Calibration Macro Attributes

entry.name: Pixel Spacing
entry.description: Physical distance in the patient between the center of each pixel, specified by a numeric pair - adjacent row spacing (delimiter) adjacent column spacing in mm. See 10.7.1.1 and 10.7.1.3. Required if the image has been calibrated. May be present otherwise.

entry.name: Pixel Spacing Calibration Type
entry.description: The type of correction for the effect of geometric magnification or calibration against an object of known size, if any. See 10.7.1.2.

entry.name: Pixel Spacing Calibration Description
entry.description: A free text description of the type of correction or calibration performed. Notes: 1. In the case of correction, the text might include description of the assumptions made about the body part and geometry and depth within the patient. 2. in the case of calibration, the text might include a description of the fiducial and where it is located (e.g., "XYZ device applied to the skin over the greater trochanter"). 3. Though it is not required, the Device Module may be used to describe the specific characteristics and size of the calibration device. Required if Pixel Spacing Calibration Type (0028,0A02) is present.

entry.name: Referenced SOP Class UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Class.

entry.name: Referenced SOP Instance UID
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced SOP Instance.

entry.name: Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this SOP Instance.

entry.name: Content Label
entry.description: A label that is used to identify this SOP Instance.

entry.name: Content Description
entry.description: A description of the content of the SOP Instance.

entry.name: Content Creator's Name
entry.description: Name of operator (such as a technologist or physician) creating the content of the SOP Instance.

entry.name: Content Creator's Identification Code Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the person who created the real world value mapping. Only a single item shall be present in this sequence.

entry.name: Contributing SOP Instances Reference Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that identifies the contributing SOP Instances. Required if this SOP Instance is created from other DICOM SOP Instances. Note: The attribute is absent in the case where the sources used to create this SOP Instance are not SOP Instances, e.g., a volume that was directly generated by an acquisition system. One or more Items may be present.

entry.name: >Study Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier for the Study of the Contributing SOP Instances.

entry.name: >Referenced Series Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items each of which includes the Attributes of one Series. One or more Items may be present.

entry.name: >>Series Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier of the Series containing the referenced Instances.

entry.name: >>Series Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this Series.

entry.name: >>Referenced Instance Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of Items each providing a reference to an Instance that is part of the Series defined by Series Instance UID (0020,000E) in the enclosing Item. One or more Items may be present.

entry.name: >>>Instance Number
entry.description: A number that identifies this instance.

entry.name: Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of the equipment that produced the sources.

entry.name: Manufacturer's Model Name
entry.description: Manufacturer's model name of the equipment that produced the sources. Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

entry.name: Device Serial Number
entry.description: Manufacturer's serial number of the equipment that produced the sources. Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

entry.name: Software Versions
entry.description: Manufacturer's designation of software version of the equipment that produced the sources. Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

entry.name: Acquisition DateTime
entry.description: The time the acquisition of data that resulted in sources started. The value shall be the start date and time of the first contributing SOP Instance of the group specified by the Contributing SOP Instances Reference Sequence (0020,9529). Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances. Note: The Acquisition DateTime may be created by combining the values of Acquisition Date (0008,0022) and Acquisition Time (0008,0032) attributes in the contributing SOP Instances.

entry.name: Station Name
entry.description: User defined name identifying the machine that produced the sources. Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

entry.name: Operators' Name
entry.description: Name(s) of the operator(s) supporting the Series. Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

entry.name: Operator Identification Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the operator(s) supporting the Series. One or more items shall be included in this sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Operators' Name (0008,1070), if present. Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

entry.name: Protocol Name
entry.description: User-defined description of the conditions under which the Series was performed. Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances. Note: This attribute conveys series-specific protocol identification and may or may not be identical to the one presented in the Performed Protocol Code Sequence (0040,0260).

entry.name: Performed Protocol Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence describing the Protocol performed for the Procedure Step creating the sources. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence. Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Acquisition Protocol Name
entry.description: User defined name of the protocol used to acquire this image. Required if present and consistent in the contributing SOP Instances.

entry.name: Rows
entry.description: Number of rows in the images.

entry.name: Columns
entry.description: Number of columns in the images.

entry.name: Bits Stored
entry.description: Number of bits stored for each pixel sample. Each sample shall have the same number of bits stored. See PS 3.5 for further explanation.

entry.name: Lossy Image Compression
entry.description: Specifies whether the Source Images have undergone lossy compression. Enumerated Values: 00 = Image has NOT been subjected to lossy compression. 01 = Image has been subjected to lossy compression. See C.7.6.1.1.5 for further explanation. Required if it is known whether or not Lossy Compression has been performed on the Images. Note: In some SOP Class definitions the Lossy Image Compression attribute is optional.
entry.section:
The Attribute Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) conveys that the Image has undergone lossy compression. It provides a means to record that the Image has been compressed (at a point in its lifetime) with a lossy algorithm and changes have been introduced into the pixel data. Once the value has been set to “01”, it shall not be reset. Note: If an image is compressed with a lossy algorithm, the attribute Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) is set to “01”. Subsequently, if the image is decompressed and transferred in uncompressed format, this attribute value remains “01”.
The value of the Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) Attribute in SOP Instances containing multiple frames in which one or more of the frames have undergone lossy compression shall be “01”. Note: It is recommended that the applicable frames be noted in the Attribute Derivation Description (0008,2111).
If an image is originally obtained as a lossy compressed image from the sensor, then Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) is set to “01” and Value 1 of the Attribute Image Type (0008,0008) shall be set to ORIGINAL. If an image is a compressed version of another image, Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) is set to “01”, Value 1 of the Attribute Image Type (0008,0008) shall be set to DERIVED, and if the predecessor was a DICOM image, then the Image shall receive a new SOP Instance UID. Note: 1. It is recommended that the approximate compression ratio be provided in the Attribute Derivation Description (0008,2111). Furthermore, it is recommended that Derivation Description (0008,2111) be used to indicate when pixel data changes might affect professional interpretation. (see C.7.6.1.1.3). 2. The attribute Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) is defined as Type 3 for backward compatibility with existing IODs. It is expected to be required (i.e., defined as Type 1C) for new Image IODs and for existing IODs that undergo a major revision (e.g. a new IOD is specified). The Defined Terms for Lossy Image Compression Method (0028,2114) are: ISO_10918_1 = JPEG Lossy Compression ISO_14495_1 = JPEG-LS Near-lossless Compression ISO_15444_1 = JPEG 2000 Irreversible Compression ISO_13818_2 = MPEG2 Compression

entry.name: Lossy Image Compression Ratio
entry.description: See C.7.6.1.1.5 for further explanation. Required if Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) equals 01.
entry.section:
The Attribute Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) conveys that the Image has undergone lossy compression. It provides a means to record that the Image has been compressed (at a point in its lifetime) with a lossy algorithm and changes have been introduced into the pixel data. Once the value has been set to “01”, it shall not be reset. Note: If an image is compressed with a lossy algorithm, the attribute Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) is set to “01”. Subsequently, if the image is decompressed and transferred in uncompressed format, this attribute value remains “01”.
The value of the Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) Attribute in SOP Instances containing multiple frames in which one or more of the frames have undergone lossy compression shall be “01”. Note: It is recommended that the applicable frames be noted in the Attribute Derivation Description (0008,2111).
If an image is originally obtained as a lossy compressed image from the sensor, then Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) is set to “01” and Value 1 of the Attribute Image Type (0008,0008) shall be set to ORIGINAL. If an image is a compressed version of another image, Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) is set to “01”, Value 1 of the Attribute Image Type (0008,0008) shall be set to DERIVED, and if the predecessor was a DICOM image, then the Image shall receive a new SOP Instance UID. Note: 1. It is recommended that the approximate compression ratio be provided in the Attribute Derivation Description (0008,2111). Furthermore, it is recommended that Derivation Description (0008,2111) be used to indicate when pixel data changes might affect professional interpretation. (see C.7.6.1.1.3). 2. The attribute Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) is defined as Type 3 for backward compatibility with existing IODs. It is expected to be required (i.e., defined as Type 1C) for new Image IODs and for existing IODs that undergo a major revision (e.g. a new IOD is specified). The Defined Terms for Lossy Image Compression Method (0028,2114) are: ISO_10918_1 = JPEG Lossy Compression ISO_14495_1 = JPEG-LS Near-lossless Compression ISO_15444_1 = JPEG 2000 Irreversible Compression ISO_13818_2 = MPEG2 Compression

entry.name: Lossy Image Compression Method
entry.description: A label for the lossy compression method(s) that have been applied to the source images. See C.7.6.1.1.5 for further explanation. May be multi-valued if successive lossy compression steps have been applied; the value order shall correspond to the values of Lossy Image Compression Ratio (0028,2112). Note: For historical reasons, the lossy compression method may also be described in Derivation Description (0008,2111). Required if Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) equals 01.
entry.section:
The Attribute Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) conveys that the Image has undergone lossy compression. It provides a means to record that the Image has been compressed (at a point in its lifetime) with a lossy algorithm and changes have been introduced into the pixel data. Once the value has been set to “01”, it shall not be reset. Note: If an image is compressed with a lossy algorithm, the attribute Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) is set to “01”. Subsequently, if the image is decompressed and transferred in uncompressed format, this attribute value remains “01”.
The value of the Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) Attribute in SOP Instances containing multiple frames in which one or more of the frames have undergone lossy compression shall be “01”. Note: It is recommended that the applicable frames be noted in the Attribute Derivation Description (0008,2111).
If an image is originally obtained as a lossy compressed image from the sensor, then Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) is set to “01” and Value 1 of the Attribute Image Type (0008,0008) shall be set to ORIGINAL. If an image is a compressed version of another image, Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) is set to “01”, Value 1 of the Attribute Image Type (0008,0008) shall be set to DERIVED, and if the predecessor was a DICOM image, then the Image shall receive a new SOP Instance UID. Note: 1. It is recommended that the approximate compression ratio be provided in the Attribute Derivation Description (0008,2111). Furthermore, it is recommended that Derivation Description (0008,2111) be used to indicate when pixel data changes might affect professional interpretation. (see C.7.6.1.1.3). 2. The attribute Lossy Image Compression (0028,2110) is defined as Type 3 for backward compatibility with existing IODs. It is expected to be required (i.e., defined as Type 1C) for new Image IODs and for existing IODs that undergo a major revision (e.g. a new IOD is specified). The Defined Terms for Lossy Image Compression Method (0028,2114) are: ISO_10918_1 = JPEG Lossy Compression ISO_14495_1 = JPEG-LS Near-lossless Compression ISO_15444_1 = JPEG 2000 Irreversible Compression ISO_13818_2 = MPEG2 Compression

entry.name: Patient Orientation Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that describes the orientation of the patient with respect to gravity. See C.8.11.5.1.2 for further explanation. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.
entry.section: This Attribute is not related to Patient Orientation (0020,0020) and conveys a different concept entirely.

include.description: Baseline Context ID 19

entry.name: > Patient Orientation Modifier Code Sequence
entry.description: Patient orientation modifier. Required if needed to fully specify the orientation of the patient with respect to gravity. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

include.description: Baseline Context ID 20

entry.name: Patient Gantry Relationship Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that describes the orientation of the patient with respect to the head of the table. See Section C.8.4.6.1.3 for further explanation. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.
entry.section: Patient Gantry Relationship Code Sequence (0054,0414) is used to describe the patient direction within the gantry, such as head-first or feet-first. When imaging the extremities, these directions are related to normal anatomic position. Example: In normal anatomic position, the fingers point towards the feet.

include.description: Baseline Context ID 21

macro.name: Performed Procedure Step Summary Macro Attributes

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step ID
entry.description: User or equipment generated identifier of that part of a Procedure that has been carried out within this step.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Start Date
entry.description: Date on which the Performed Procedure Step started.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Start Time
entry.description: Time on which the Performed Procedure Step started.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Description
entry.description: Institution-generated description or classification of the Procedure Step that was performed.

entry.name: Performed Protocol Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence describing the Protocol performed for this Procedure Step. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

include.description: Context ID may be defined in the macro invocation.

entry.name: >Protocol Context Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies the context for the Performed Protocol Code Sequence Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

include.description: Context ID may be defined in the macro invocation.

entry.name: >> Content Item Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies modifiers for a Protocol Context Content Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See Section C.4.10.1.
entry.section: The Protocol Context Sequence (0040,0440) allows the specification of parameters that further qualify the scheduled protocol, provided through a set of generic name/value pairs of context Content Items. Note: This allows the specification of clinical, acquisition, or procedural qualifiers for the scheduled protocol, such as a specific body part, imaging technique, or parameters of a preparatory event (e.g., radionuclide injection). Specific uses of this Sequence may be documented in a Template defined in accordance with PS3.16.

include.description: Context ID may be defined in the macro invocation.

entry.description: User-defined comments on the Performed Procedure Step.

entry.usage: C - Required if contrast media was used in this image

entry.usage: C - Required if contrast media was used in this image

entry.usage: C - Required if contrast media was used in this image

entry.usage: U - See Section A.5.4.1

entry.usage: C - Required if Image Type (0008,0008) Value 3 is TOMO, GATED TOMO, RECON TOMO or RECON GATED TOMO

entry.name: Referenced Study Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Study SOP Instances associated with the Patient SOP Instance. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: Referenced Visit Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Visit SOP Instances associated with this Patient SOP Instance. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: Referenced Patient Alias Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies any Patient SOP Instances that also describe this patient. These SOP Instances are aliases. Zero or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: Patient's Name
entry.description: Patient's full name

entry.name: Patient ID
entry.description: Primary hospital identification number or code for the patient.

entry.name: Issuer of Patient ID
entry.description: Identifier of the Assigning Authority (system, organization, agency, or department) that issued the Patient ID. Note: Issuer of Patient ID (0010,0021) is equivalent to HL7 v2 PID-3 component 4.

entry.name: Other Patient IDs
entry.description: Other identification numbers or codes used to identify the patient.

entry.name: Other Patient IDs Sequence
entry.description: A sequence of identification numbers or codes used to identify the patient, which may or may not be human readable, and may or may not have been obtained from an implanted or attached device such as an RFID or barcode.

entry.name: >Patient ID
entry.description: An identification number or code used to identify the patient

entry.name: >Issuer of Patient ID
entry.description: Identifier of the Assigning Authority that issued the Patient ID.

entry.name: >Type of Patient ID
entry.description: The type of identifier in this item. Defined Terms: TEXT RFID BARCODE Note: The identifier is coded as a string regardless of the type, not as a binary value.

entry.name: Other Patient Names
entry.description: Other names used to identify the patient.

entry.name: Patient's Birth Name
entry.description: Patient's birth name.

entry.name: Patient's Mother's Birth Name
entry.description: Birth name of patient's mother.

entry.name: Medical Record Locator
entry.description: An identifier used to find the patient's existing medical record (e.g. film jacket).

entry.name: Patient's Age
entry.description: Age of the Patient.

entry.name: Occupation
entry.description: Occupation of the Patient.

entry.name: Confidentiality Constraint on Patient Data Description
entry.description: Special indication to the modality operator about confidentiality of patient information (e.g., that he should not use the patients name where other patients are present).

entry.name: Patient's Birth Date
entry.description: Date of birth of the named patient

entry.name: Patient's Birth Time
entry.description: Time of birth of the named patient

entry.name: Patient's Sex
entry.description: Sex of the named patient. Enumerated Values: M = male F = female O = other

entry.name: Patient's Insurance Plan Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that conveys the patient's insurance plan. Zero or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Patient's Primary Language Code Sequence
entry.description: The languages that can be used to communicate with the patient. Zero or more Items may be included in the sequence. The sequence items are ordered by preference (most preferred language to least preferred language).

include.description: Baseline Context ID is CID 5000 - Languages.

entry.name: > Patient's Primary Language Code Modifier Sequence
entry.description: A modifer for a Patient's Primary Language. Can be used to specify a national language variant. Exactly one Item may be included in the sequence.

include.description: Baseline Context ID is CID 5001 - Countries.

entry.name: Patient's Size
entry.description: Patient's height or length in meters

entry.name: Patient's Weight
entry.description: Weight of the patient in kilograms

entry.name: Patient's Address
entry.description: Legal address of the named patient

entry.name: Military Rank
entry.description: Military rank of patient

entry.name: Branch of Service
entry.description: Branch of the military. The country allegiance may also be included (e.g. U.S. Army).

entry.name: Country of Residence
entry.description: Country in which patient currently resides

entry.name: Region of Residence
entry.description: Region within patient's country of residence

entry.name: Patient's Telephone Numbers
entry.description: Telephone numbers at which the patient can be reached

entry.name: Ethnic Group
entry.description: Ethnic group or race of patient

entry.name: Patient's Religious Preference
entry.description: The religious preference of the patient

entry.name: Patient Comments
entry.description: User-defined comments about the patient

entry.name: Responsible Person
entry.description: Name of person with medical decision making authority for the patient.

entry.name: Responsible Person Role
entry.description: Relationship of Responsible Person to the patient. Defined Terms: OWNER

entry.name: Responsible Organization
entry.description: Name of organization with medical decision making authority for the patient.

entry.name: Patient Species Description
entry.description: The species of the patient.

entry.name: Patient Species Code Sequence
entry.description: The species of the patient.

include.description: Defined Context ID is 7454.

entry.name: Patient Breed Description
entry.description: The breed of the patient.

entry.name: Patient Breed Code Sequence
entry.description: The breed of the patient.

include.description: Defined Context ID is 7480.

entry.name: Breed Registration Sequence
entry.description: Information identifying an animal within a breed registry.

entry.name: >Breed Registration Number
entry.description: Identification number of a veterinary patient within the registry.

entry.name: >Breed Registry Code Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the organization with which an animal is registered.

include.description: Defined Context ID is 7481.

entry.name: Medical Alerts
entry.description: Conditions to which medical staff should be alerted (e.g. contagious condition, drug allergies, etc.)

entry.name: Allergies
entry.description: Description of prior reaction to contrast agents, or other patient allergies or adverse reactions.

entry.name: Smoking Status
entry.description: Indicates whether patient smokes. Enumerated Values: YES NO UNKNOWN

entry.name: Additional Patient History
entry.description: Additional information about the patient's medical history

entry.name: Pregnancy Status
entry.description: Describes pregnancy state of patient. Enumerated Values: 0001 = not pregnant 0002 = possibly pregnant 0003 = definitely pregnant 0004 = unknown

entry.name: Last Menstrual Date
entry.description: Date of onset of last menstrual period

entry.name: Patient's Sex Neutered
entry.description: Whether or not a procedure has been performed in an effort to render the patient sterile. Enumerated value: ALTERED = Altered/Neutered UNALTERED = Unaltered/intact

entry.name: Special Needs
entry.description: Medical and social needs (e.g. wheelchair, oxygen, translator, etc.)

entry.name: Patient State
entry.description: Description of patient state (comatose, disoriented, vision impaired, etc.)

entry.name: Pertinent Documents Sequence
entry.description: List of Documents (e.g., SR, or CDA) that contain information considered pertinent for the patient medical condition. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Purpose of Reference Code Sequence
entry.description: Describes the purpose for which the document reference is made. Zero or more Items may be present.

include.description: No Baseline Context Group ID defined

entry.name: >Document Title
entry.description: Title of the referenced document.

entry.name: Patient Clinical Trial Participation Sequence
entry.description: Sequence of identifiers for clinical trials in which the patient participates. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Clinical Trial Sponsor Name
entry.description: The name of the clinical trial sponsor, responsible for conducting the clinical trial and for defining the Clinical Trial Protocol.

entry.name: >Clinical Trial Protocol ID
entry.description: Identifier for the noted protocol, used by the Clinical Trial Sponsor to uniquely identify the investigational protocol.

entry.name: >Clinical Trial Protocol Name
entry.description: The name or title of the clinical trial protocol.

entry.name: >Clinical Trial Site ID
entry.description: The identifier, issued by the Clinical Trial Sponsor, of the site responsible for submitting clinical trial data.

entry.name: >Clinical Trial Site Name
entry.description: Name of the site responsible for submitting clinical trial data.

entry.name: >Clinical Trial Subject ID
entry.description: The assigned identifier for the patient as a clinical trial subject.

entry.name: >Clinical Trial Subject Reading ID
entry.description: Identifies the patient as a clinical trial subject for blinded evaluations.

entry.name: Referenced Study Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Study SOP Instances associated with the Visit SOP Instance. One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

entry.name: Referenced Patient Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Patient SOP Instance that relates to the Visit SOP Instance. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

entry.name: Institution Name
entry.description: Institution where the equipment is located

entry.name: Institution Address
entry.description: Mailing Address of the institution where the equipment is located

entry.name: Institution Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that conveys the healthcare facility identification. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this Sequence.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Admission ID
entry.description: Identification number of the visit as assigned by the healthcare provider

entry.name: Issuer of Admission ID
entry.description: Name of healthcare provider which issued the Admission ID

entry.name: Service Episode ID
entry.description: Identifier of the Service Episode as assigned by the healthcare provider

entry.name: Issuer of Service Episode ID
entry.description: Name of healthcare provider that issued the Service Episode ID

entry.name: Service Episode Description
entry.description: Description of the type of service episode.

entry.name: Visit Status ID
entry.description: Identifies the state of the visit. Defined Terms: CREATED = Created but not yet scheduled SCHEDULED = Scheduled but not yet admitted ADMITTED = Patient admitted to institution DISCHARGED = Patient Discharged

entry.name: Current Patient Location
entry.description: Describes the current known location of the patient

entry.name: Patient's Institution Residence
entry.description: Primary location where patient resides (ward, floor, room, etc. or outpatient)

entry.name: Visit Comments
entry.description: User-defined comments about the visit

entry.name: Referring Physician's Name
entry.description: Patient's primary referring physician for this visit

entry.name: Referring Physician's Address
entry.description: Referring physician's address

entry.name: Referring Physician's Telephone Numbers
entry.description: Referring physician's telephone numbers

entry.name: Referring Physician Identification Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the patient's referring physician. Only a single item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: Admitting Diagnoses Description
entry.description: Description of admitting diagnosis (diagnoses).

entry.name: Admitting Diagnoses Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that conveys the admitting diagnosis (diagnoses). One or more Items may be included in this Sequence.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Route of Admissions
entry.description: Mode of admission: emergency, normal

entry.name: Admitting Date
entry.description: Date patient visit began

entry.name: Admitting Time
entry.description: Time patient visit began

entry.name: Scheduled Procedure Step Sequence
entry.description: One or more Scheduled Procedure Steps for one Requested Procedure.

entry.name: >Scheduled Station AE Title
entry.description: The AE title of the modality on which the Scheduled Procedure Step is scheduled to be performed.

entry.name: >Scheduled Station Name
entry.description: An institution defined name for the modality on which the Scheduled Procedure Step is scheduled to be performed.

entry.name: >Scheduled Procedure Step Location
entry.description: The location at which the Procedure Step is scheduled to be performed.

entry.name: >Scheduled Procedure Step Start Date
entry.description: Date on which the Scheduled Procedure Step is scheduled to start.

entry.name: >Scheduled Procedure Step Start Time
entry.description: Time at which the Scheduled Procedure Step is scheduled to start.

entry.name: >Scheduled Procedure Step End Date
entry.description: Date on which the Scheduled Procedure Step is scheduled to end.

entry.name: >Scheduled Procedure Step End Time
entry.description: Time at which the Scheduled Procedure Step is scheduled to end.

entry.name: >Scheduled Performing Physician's Name
entry.description: Name of the physician scheduled to administer the Scheduled Procedure Step.

entry.name: >Scheduled Performing Physician Identification Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the physician scheduled to administer the Scheduled Procedure Step. Only a single item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >Scheduled Procedure Step Description
entry.description: Institution-generated description or classification of the Scheduled Procedure Step to be performed. Note: The purpose of this attribute is to store a description or classification that is used at a local level (e.g., a hospital or a managed care network), and this description need not comply to an accepted standard.

entry.name: >Scheduled Protocol Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence describing the Scheduled Protocol following a specified coding scheme. This sequence contains one or more Items.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: >>Protocol Context Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies the context for the Scheduled Protocol Code Sequence Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See Section C.4.10.1.
entry.section: The Protocol Context Sequence (0040,0440) allows the specification of parameters that further qualify the scheduled protocol, provided through a set of generic name/value pairs of context Content Items. Note: This allows the specification of clinical, acquisition, or procedural qualifiers for the scheduled protocol, such as a specific body part, imaging technique, or parameters of a preparatory event (e.g., radionuclide injection). Specific uses of this Sequence may be documented in a Template defined in accordance with PS3.16.

include.description: No Baseline Template is defined.

entry.name: >>> Content Item Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies modifiers for a Protocol Context Content Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See Section C.4.10.1.
entry.section: The Protocol Context Sequence (0040,0440) allows the specification of parameters that further qualify the scheduled protocol, provided through a set of generic name/value pairs of context Content Items. Note: This allows the specification of clinical, acquisition, or procedural qualifiers for the scheduled protocol, such as a specific body part, imaging technique, or parameters of a preparatory event (e.g., radionuclide injection). Specific uses of this Sequence may be documented in a Template defined in accordance with PS3.16.

include.description: No Baseline Template is defined.

entry.name: >Scheduled Procedure Step ID
entry.description: Identifier that identifies the Scheduled Procedure Step.

entry.name: >Scheduled Procedure Step Status
entry.description: A real world condition that may affect the selection of of the Scheduled Procedure Step. Defined Terms: SCHEDULED - Procedure Step scheduled ARRIVED - patient is available for the Scheduled Procedure Step READY - all patient and other necessary preparation for this step has been completed STARTED - at least one Performed Procedure Step has been created that references this Scheduled Procedure Step

entry.name: >Comments on the Scheduled Procedure Step
entry.description: User-defined comments on the Scheduled Procedure Step. Note: The Comments attribute is intended to transmit non-structured information, which can be displayed to the operator of the Modality.

entry.name: >Modality
entry.description: Source equipment for the image. See Section C.7.3.1.1.1 for Defined Terms.
entry.section:
Defined Terms for the Modality (0008,0060) are:
Retired Defined Terms for the Modality (0008,0060) are:
Note: 1. The XA modality incorporates the retired modality DS. 2. The RF modality incorporates the retired modalities CF, DF, VF. 3. The modality listed in the Modality Data Element (0008,0060) may not match the name of the IOD in which it appears. For example, a SOP instance from XA IOD may list the RF modality when an RF implementation produces an XA object. 4. The MR modality incorporates the retired modalities MA and MS.

entry.name: >Requested Contrast Agent
entry.description: Contrast agent requested for use in the Scheduled Procedure Step.

entry.name: >Pre-Medication
entry.description: Medication to be administered at the beginning of the Scheduled Procedure Step, e.g. Nuclear Medicine radiopharmaceutical.

entry.name: Requested Procedure ID
entry.description: Identifier that identifies the Requested Procedure in the Imaging Service Request.

entry.name: Reason for the Requested Procedure
entry.description: Reason for requesting this imaging procedure. Note: This reason is more specific to the requested procedure than the reason mentioned in the imaging service request (0040,2001).

entry.name: Requested Procedure Comments
entry.description: User-defined comments on the Requested Procedure.

entry.name: Reason for Requested Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: Coded Reason for requesting this procedure. One or more sequence items may be present.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Requested Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that conveys the Requested Procedure of one Procedure Type.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Study Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier to be used to identify the Study

entry.name: Study Date
entry.description: Date the Study started, if any previous procedure steps within the same study have already been performed.

entry.name: Study Time
entry.description: Time the Study started, if any previous procedure steps within the same study have already been performed.

entry.name: Referenced Study Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Study SOP Instances associated with this SOP Instance.

entry.name: Requested Procedure Description
entry.description: Institution-generated administrative description or classification of Requested Procedure

entry.name: Requested Procedure Priority
entry.description: Requested Procedure Type Urgency. Defined Terms: STAT, HIGH, ROUTINE, MEDIUM, LOW

entry.name: Patient Transport Arrangements
entry.description: Mode of transportation of the patient to the location of examination.

entry.name: Requested Procedure Location
entry.description: Physical location at which the Requested Procedure is to be performed.

entry.name: Confidentiality Code
entry.description: Confidentiality Constraints on the Requested Procedure by the party filling the order.

entry.name: Reporting Priority
entry.description: Requested Reporting Priority. Defined Terms: HIGH, ROUTINE, MEDIUM, LOW

entry.name: Names of Intended Recipients of Results
entry.description: Names of the physicians, who are intended recipients of results.

entry.name: Intended Recipients of Results Identification Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the physicians who are intended recipients of results. One or more items shall be included in this sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Names of Intended Recipients of Results (0040,1010), if present.

entry.name: Imaging Service Request Comments
entry.description: User-defined comments on the Imaging Service Request. Note: The Comments attribute is intended to transmit non-structured information, which can be displayed to the operator of the equipment (e.g. Modality).

entry.name: Requesting Physician
entry.description: Name of the physician who requested the Imaging Service Request.

entry.name: Requesting Physician Identification Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the physician who requested the Imaging Service Request. Only a single item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: Referring Physician's Name
entry.description: Name of the patient's referring physician for this Imaging Service Request.

entry.name: Referring Physician Identification Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the patient's referring physician. Only a single item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: Requesting Service
entry.description: Institutional department where the request initiated.

entry.name: Accession Number
entry.description: A departmental IS generated number that identifies the order for the Imaging Service Request.

entry.name: Issue Date of Imaging Service Request
entry.description: Date on which the Imaging Service Request was issued by the requester.

entry.name: Issue Time of Imaging Service Request
entry.description: Time at which the Imaging Service Request was issued by the requester.

entry.name: Placer Order Number / Imaging Service Request
entry.description: The order number assigned to the Imaging Service Request by the party placing the order.

entry.name: Filler Order Number / Imaging Service Request
entry.description: The order number assigned to the Imaging Service Request by the party filling the order.

entry.name: Order entered by ...
entry.description: The person who entered the Imaging Service Request into an Information System.

entry.name: Order Enterer's Location
entry.description: The location at which the Imaging Service Request was entered.

entry.name: Order Callback Phone Number
entry.description: Telephone Number at which additional information can be retrieved.

entry.name: Admission ID
entry.description: Identification number of the visit as assigned by the healthcare provider

entry.name: Issuer of Admission ID
entry.description: Name of healthcare provider that issued the Admission ID

module.name: Performed Procedure Step Relationship Module Attributes

entry.name: Patient's Name
entry.description: Patient's full legal name.

entry.name: Patient ID
entry.description: Primary hospital identification number or code for the patient.

entry.name: Issuer of Patient ID
entry.description: Identifier of the Assigning Authority that issued the Patient ID.

entry.name: Patient's Birth Date
entry.description: Date of birth of the named patient

entry.name: Patient's Sex
entry.description: Sex of the named Patient. Enumerated Values: M = male F = female O = other

entry.name: Referenced Patient Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Patient SOP Instance.

entry.name: Service Episode ID
entry.description: Identifier of the Service Episode as assigned by the healthcare provider

entry.name: Issuer of Service Episode ID
entry.description: Name of healthcare provider that issued the Service Episode ID

entry.name: Service Episode Description
entry.description: Description of the type of service episode.

entry.name: Scheduled Step Attributes Sequence
entry.description: Sequence containing attributes that are related to the scheduling of the Procedure Step. The Sequence may have one or more Items.

entry.name: >Study Instance UID
entry.description: Unique identifier for the Study.

entry.name: >Referenced Study Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the Study SOP Instance associated with this Scheduled Procedure Step. This Sequence shall have only one Item.

entry.name: >Accession Number
entry.description: A departmental IS generated number that identifies the order for the Study.

entry.name: >Placer Order Number/Imaging Service Request
entry.description: The order number assigned to the Imaging Service Request by the party placing the order.

entry.name: >Filler Order Number/Imaging Service Request
entry.description: The order number assigned to the Imaging Service Request by the party filling the order.

entry.name: >Requested Procedure ID
entry.description: Identifier of the related Requested Procedure.

entry.name: >Requested Procedure Description
entry.description: Institution-generated administrative description or classification of Requested Procedure.

entry.name: >Requested Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that conveys the Procedure Type of the requested procedure. The Requested Procedure Code Sequence shall contain only a single item.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: >Scheduled Procedure Step ID
entry.description: Identifier of the related Scheduled Procedure Step.

entry.name: >Scheduled Procedure Step Description
entry.description: Institution-generated description or classification of the Scheduled Procedure Step to be performed.

entry.name: >Scheduled Protocol Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence describing the Scheduled Protocol following a specific coding scheme. This sequence contains one or more Items.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: >>Protocol Context Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies the context for the Scheduled Protocol Code Sequence Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See Section C.4.10.1.
entry.section: The Protocol Context Sequence (0040,0440) allows the specification of parameters that further qualify the scheduled protocol, provided through a set of generic name/value pairs of context Content Items. Note: This allows the specification of clinical, acquisition, or procedural qualifiers for the scheduled protocol, such as a specific body part, imaging technique, or parameters of a preparatory event (e.g., radionuclide injection). Specific uses of this Sequence may be documented in a Template defined in accordance with PS3.16.

include.description: No Baseline Template is defined.

entry.name: >>> Content Item Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies modifiers for a Protocol Context Content Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See Section C.4.10.1.
entry.section: The Protocol Context Sequence (0040,0440) allows the specification of parameters that further qualify the scheduled protocol, provided through a set of generic name/value pairs of context Content Items. Note: This allows the specification of clinical, acquisition, or procedural qualifiers for the scheduled protocol, such as a specific body part, imaging technique, or parameters of a preparatory event (e.g., radionuclide injection). Specific uses of this Sequence may be documented in a Template defined in accordance with PS3.16.

include.description: No Baseline Template is defined.

module.name: Performed Procedure Step Information Module Attributes

entry.name: Performed Station AE Title
entry.description: AE title of the modality on which the Performed Procedure Step was performed.

entry.name: Performed Station Name
entry.description: An institution defined name for the modality on which the Performed Procedure Step was performed.

entry.name: Performed Location
entry.description: Description of the location at which the Performed Procedure Step was performed.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Start Date
entry.description: Date on which the Performed Procedure Step started. Note: This value may be used to determine the earliest date to use as the Study Date (0008,0020) in composite instances and in updated Modality Scheduled Procedure Steps in order to allow Study level attributes to have consistent values if additional Procedure Steps are performed.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Start Time
entry.description: Time at which the Performed Procedure Step started. Note: This value may be used to determine the earliest time to use as the Study Time (0008,0030) in composite instances and in updated Modality Scheduled Procedure Steps in order to allow Study level attributes to have consistent values if additional Procedure Steps are performed.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step ID
entry.description: User or equipment generated identifier of that part of a Procedure that has been carried out within this step.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step End Date
entry.description: Date on which the Performed Procedure Step ended.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step End Time
entry.description: Time at which the Performed Procedure Step ended.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Status
entry.description: Contains the state of the Performed Procedure Step. Enumerated Values: IN PROGRESS = Started but not complete DISCONTINUED = Canceled or unsuccessfully terminated COMPLETED = Successfully completed

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Description
entry.description: Institution-generated description or classification of the Procedure Step that was performed.

entry.name: Comments on the Performed Procedure Step
entry.description: User-defined comments on the Performed Procedure Step.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Type Description
entry.description: A description of the type of procedure performed.

entry.name: Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that conveys the (single) type of procedure performed.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Performed Procedure Step Discontinuation Reason Code Sequence
entry.description: The reason the Performed Procedure Step Status (0040,0252) was set to DISCONTINUED.

include.description: Defined Context ID is 9300.

entry.name: Modality
entry.description: Type of equipment that originally acquired the data used to create the images associated with this Modality Performed Procedure Step. See C.7.3.1.1.1 for Defined Terms. Note: A Modality value in the created SOP Instances may be different from the MPPS Modality value. For example, multiple series may have been created during the MPPS (images, waveforms, softcopy presentation states and/or structured reports) with SOP Instances in different series having different modality values.
entry.section:
Defined Terms for the Modality (0008,0060) are:
Retired Defined Terms for the Modality (0008,0060) are:
Note: 1. The XA modality incorporates the retired modality DS. 2. The RF modality incorporates the retired modalities CF, DF, VF. 3. The modality listed in the Modality Data Element (0008,0060) may not match the name of the IOD in which it appears. For example, a SOP instance from XA IOD may list the RF modality when an RF implementation produces an XA object. 4. The MR modality incorporates the retired modalities MA and MS.

entry.name: Study ID
entry.description: User or equipment generated Study Identifier.

entry.name: Performed Protocol Code Sequence
entry.description: Sequence describing the Protocol performed for this Procedure Step. This sequence may have zero or more Items.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: >Protocol Context Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies the context for the Performed Protocol Code Sequence Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See Section C.4.10.1.
entry.section: The Protocol Context Sequence (0040,0440) allows the specification of parameters that further qualify the scheduled protocol, provided through a set of generic name/value pairs of context Content Items. Note: This allows the specification of clinical, acquisition, or procedural qualifiers for the scheduled protocol, such as a specific body part, imaging technique, or parameters of a preparatory event (e.g., radionuclide injection). Specific uses of this Sequence may be documented in a Template defined in accordance with PS3.16.

include.description: No Baseline Template is defined.

entry.name: >> Content Item Modifier Sequence
entry.description: Sequence that specifies modifiers for a Protocol Context Content Item. One or more items may be included in this sequence. See Section C.4.10.1.
entry.section: The Protocol Context Sequence (0040,0440) allows the specification of parameters that further qualify the scheduled protocol, provided through a set of generic name/value pairs of context Content Items. Note: This allows the specification of clinical, acquisition, or procedural qualifiers for the scheduled protocol, such as a specific body part, imaging technique, or parameters of a preparatory event (e.g., radionuclide injection). Specific uses of this Sequence may be documented in a Template defined in accordance with PS3.16.

include.description: No Baseline Template is defined.

entry.name: Performed Series Sequence
entry.description: Attributes of the Series that comprise this Modality Performed Procedure Step. The Sequence may have zero or more Items.

entry.name: >Performing Physician's Name
entry.description: Name of the physician(s) administering this Series.

entry.name: >Performing Physician Identification Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the physician(s) administering the Series. One or more items shall be included in this sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Performing Physician's Name (0008,1050), if present.

entry.name: >Operators' Name
entry.description: Name(s) of the operator(s) who supporting this Series.

entry.name: >Operator Identification Sequence
entry.description: Identification of the operator(s) supporting the Series. One or more items shall be included in this sequence. If more than one Item, the number and order shall correspond to the value of Operators' Name (0008,1070), if present.

entry.name: >Protocol Name
entry.description: User-defined description of the conditions under which the Series was performed. Note: This attribute conveys series-specific protocol identification and may or may not be identical to the one presented in the Performed Protocol Code Sequence (0040,0260).

entry.name: >Series Instance UID
entry.description: Unique Identifier of the Series.

entry.name: >Series Description
entry.description: User provided description of the Series

entry.name: >Retrieve AE Title
entry.description: Title of the DICOM Application Entity where the Images and other Composite SOP Instances in this Series may be retrieved on the network. Note: The duration for which this location remains valid is unspecified.

entry.name: >Archive Requested
entry.description: The instances in this series are expected to be archived in the long term archive. Defined Terms: NO, YES

entry.name: >Referenced Image Sequence
entry.description: A Sequence that provides reference to Composite SOP Instances created during the acquisition of the procedure step. The sequence may have zero or more Items. Note: The use of Referenced Image Sequence is historical, and in this context it allows the reference of any Composite SOP Instance.

entry.name: >Referenced Non-Image Composite SOP Instance Sequence
entry.description: Uniquely identifies instances, other than images, of any SOP Class that conforms to the DICOM Composite IOD Information Model, such as Waveforms, Presentation States or Structured Reports, created during the acquisition of the procedure step, and that are not referenced in Referenced Image Sequence (0008,1140). The sequence may have zero or more Items.

entry.name: Anatomic Structure, Space or Region Sequence
entry.description: Anatomic structure, space or region that has been exposed to ionizing radiation. The sequence may have zero or one Items.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Total Time of Fluoroscopy
entry.description: Total duration of X-Ray exposure during fluoroscopy in seconds (pedal time) during this Performed Procedure Step.

entry.name: Total Number of Exposures
entry.description: Total number of exposures made during this Performed Procedure Step. The number includes non-digital and digital exposures.

entry.name: Distance Source to Detector
entry.description: Distance in mm from the source to detector center. Note: This value is traditionally referred to as Source Image Receptor Distance (SID).

entry.name: Distance Source to Entrance
entry.description: Distance in mm from the source to the surface of the patient closest to the source during this Performed Procedure Step. Note: This may be an estimated value based on assumptions about the patient's body size and habitus.

entry.name: Entrance Dose
entry.description: Average entrance dose value measured in dGy at the surface of the patient during this Performed Procedure Step. Note: This may be an estimated value based on assumptions about the patient's body size and habitus.

entry.name: Entrance Dose in mGy
entry.description: Average entrance dose value measured in mGy at the surface of the patient during this Performed Procedure Step. Note: This may be an estimated value based on assumptions about the patient's body size and habitus.

entry.name: Exposed Area
entry.description: Typical dimension of the exposed area at the detector plane. If Rectangular: row dimension followed by column; if Round: diameter. Measured in mm. Notes: 1. This may be an estimated value based on assumptions about the patient's body size and habitus. 2. This attribute is used in the X-Ray Acquisition Dose Module with units in cm (see Section C 8.7.8 Table C.8-33).

entry.name: Image and Fluoroscopy Area Dose Product
entry.description: Total area-dose-product to which the patient was exposed, accumulated over the complete Performed Procedure Step and measured in dGy*cm*cm, including fluoroscopy. Notes: 1. The sum of the area dose product of all images of a Series or a Study may not result in the total area dose product to which the patient was exposed. 2. This may be an estimated value based on assumptions about the patient's body size and habitus.

entry.name: Comments on Radiation Dose
entry.description: User-defined comments on any special conditions related to radiation dose encountered during this Performed Procedure Step.

entry.name: Exposure Dose Sequence
entry.description: Exposure Dose Sequence will contain Total Number of Exposures (0040,0301) items plus an item for each fluoroscopy episode not already counted as an exposure.

entry.name: >Radiation Mode
entry.description: Specifies X-Ray radiation mode. Enumerated Values: CONTINUOUS PULSED

entry.name: >KVp
entry.description: Peak kilo voltage output of the x-ray generator used. An average in the case of fluoroscopy (continuous radiation mode).

entry.name: >X-Ray Tube Current in µA
entry.description: X-Ray Tube Current in µA. An average in the case of fluoroscopy (continuous radiation mode).

entry.name: >Exposure Time
entry.description: Time of x-ray exposure or fluoroscopy in msec.

entry.name: >Filter Type
entry.description: Type of filter(s) inserted into the X-Ray beam (e.g. wedges). See C.8.7.10 and C.8.15.3.9 (for enhanced CT) for Defined Terms.
entry.section: This Module describes the attributes related to the filtration of X-Rays during the acquisition of an X-Ray image. Table C.8-35 X-RAY FILTRATION MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: >Filter Material
entry.description: The X-Ray absorbing material used in the filter. May be multi-valued. See C.8.7.10 and C.8.15.3.9 (for enhanced CT) for Defined Terms.
entry.section: This Module describes the attributes related to the filtration of X-Rays during the acquisition of an X-Ray image. Table C.8-35 X-RAY FILTRATION MODULE ATTRIBUTES

entry.name: >Comments on Radiation Dose
entry.description: User-defined comments on any special conditions related to radiation dose encountered during during the episode described by this Exposure Dose Sequence Item.

module.name: Billing and Material Management Code Module Attributes

entry.name: Billing Procedure Step Sequence
entry.description: Contains billing codes for the Procedure Type performed within the Procedure Step. The sequence may have zero or more Items.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Film Consumption Sequence
entry.description: Information about the film consumption for this Performed Procedure Step. The sequence may have zero or more Items.

entry.name: >Number of Films
entry.description: Number of films actually printed.

entry.name: >Medium Type
entry.description: Type(s) of medium on which images were printed. For Defined Terms see Table C.13-1.

entry.name: >Film Size ID
entry.description: Size(s) of film on which images were printed. For Defined Terms see Table C.13-3.

entry.name: Billing Supplies and Devices Sequence
entry.description: Chemicals, supplies and devices for billing used in the Performed Procedure Step. The sequence may have one or more Items.

entry.name: >Billing Item Sequence
entry.description: Code values of chemicals, supplies or devices required for billing. The sequence may have zero or one Items.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: >Quantity Sequence
entry.description: Sequence containing the quantity of used chemicals or devices. The sequence may have zero or one Items.

entry.name: >>Quantity
entry.description: Numerical quantity value.

entry.name: >>Measuring Units Sequence
entry.description: Unit of measurement. The sequence may have zero or one Items.

include.description: Baseline Context ID is 82.

entry.name: >Accession Number

entry.name: >Requested Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that conveys the Procedure Type of the Requested Procedure. Zero or one Item may be included in this sequence.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: >Placer Order Number / Imaging Service Request
entry.description: The order number assigned to the Imaging Service Request by the party placing the order.

entry.name: >Filler Order Number / Imaging Service Request
entry.description: The order number assigned to the Imaging Service Request by the party filling the order.

entry.name: >Requested Procedure ID
entry.description: Identifier that identifies the Requested Procedure in the Imaging Service Request.

entry.name: >Requested Procedure Description
entry.description: Institution-generated description or classification of the Requested Procedure.

entry.name: >Reason for the Requested Procedure
entry.description: Reason for requesting this procedure.

entry.name: > Reason for Requested Procedure Code Sequence
entry.description: Coded reason for requesting this procedure.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: >Requested Procedure Comments
entry.description: User-defined comments on the Requested Procedure.

entry.name: >Confidentiality Code
entry.description: Confidentiality Constraints on the Requested Procedure by the party filling the order.

entry.name: >Names of Intended Recipients of Results
entry.description: Names of the physicians, who are intended recipients of results.

entry.name: >Imaging Service Request Comments
entry.description: User-defined comments on the Imaging Service Request.

entry.name: >Requesting Physician
entry.description: Physician who requested the Imaging Service Request.

entry.name: >Requesting Service
entry.description: Institutional department where the request initiated.

entry.name: >Issue Date of Imaging Service Request
entry.description: Date on which the Imaging Service Request was issued by the requester.

entry.name: >Issue Time of Imaging Service Request
entry.description: Time at which the Imaging Service Request was issued by the requester.

entry.name: >Referring Physician's Name
entry.description: Patient's primary physician for this Imaging Service Request.

module.name: General Purpose Scheduled Procedure Step Information Module Attributes

entry.name: General Purpose Scheduled Procedure Step Status
entry.description: A status that informs the operator and the worklist management system about the progress of the scheduled General Purpose procedure step. Enumerated Values are: SCHEDULED, IN PROGRESS, SUSPENDED, COMPLETED, DISCONTINUED. See PS 3.4 for a detailed description of the meaning and usage of these values.

entry.name: General Purpose Scheduled Procedure Step Priority
entry.description: Scheduled Procedure Step priority. Enumerated Values are: HIGH: used to indicate an urgent or emergent work item, equivalent to a STAT request. MEDIUM: used to indicate a work item that has a priority less than HIGH and higher than LOW. It can be used to further stratify work items. LOW: used to indicate a routine or non-urgent work item.

entry.name: Scheduled Procedure Step ID
entry.description: Identifier that identifies the Scheduled General Purpose Procedure Step.

entry.name: Scheduled Procedure Step Modification Date and Time
entry.description: Date and time when the General Purpose Scheduled Procedure Step was last modified or first created (whichever is most recent). Note: This attribute should be implicitly updated by the worklist management system whenever any modification is made to attributes of a General Purpose Scheduled Procedure Step. In particular, note that creation of General Purpose Performed Procedure Steps by a performing device can modify attributes of a related General Purpose Scheduled Procedure Step (e.g. the contents of Resulting General Purpose Performed Procedure Steps Sequence (0040,4015)).

entry.name: Scheduled Processing Applications Code Sequence
entry.description: The list of processing application instances and/or application types on which the General Purpose Procedure Step is scheduled. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Scheduled Station Name Code Sequence
entry.description: Identifying name within the enterprise of the equipment for which the General Purpose Scheduled Procedure Step is scheduled. The name conveyed in the Code Value (0008,0100) may be the same as the AE Title, but does not have to be. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Scheduled Station Class Code Sequence
entry.description: Class of the equipment for which the General Purpose Scheduled Procedure Step is scheduled. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Scheduled Station Geographic Location Code Sequence
entry.description: Geographic location of the equipment for which the General Purpose Scheduled Procedure Step is scheduled. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: Scheduled Human Performers Sequence
entry.description: The list of human performers that are scheduled to be involved or responsible for performing the Workitem in the General Purpose Scheduled Procedure Step. Zero or more Items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Human Performer Code Sequence
entry.description: Human performer that is involved or responsible for performing the Workitem. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

include.description: No Baseline Context ID is defined.

entry.name: >Human Performer's Name
entry.description: Name of the human performer.

entry.name: >Human Performer's Organization
entry.description: Organization to which the human performer is accountable for the activities in the Workitem.

entry.name: Scheduled Procedure Step Start Date and Time
entry.description: Date and time on which the General Purpose Scheduled Procedure Step is scheduled to start.

entry.name: Expected Completion Date and Time
entry.description: Date on which the Procedure Step is expected to be completed.

entry.name: Scheduled Workitem Code Sequence
entry.description: A sequence that conveys the code for the Workitem. Only a single Item shall be permitted in this sequence.

include.description: Baseline Context ID is CID 9231.

entry.name: Comments on the Scheduled Procedure Step
entry.description: User-defined comments on the Scheduled Procedure Step.

entry.name: Referenced Performed Procedure Step Sequence
entry.description: List of any Modality or General Purpose Performed Procedure Steps, that may be used to perform the procedure step. This sequence may contain references to performed procedure steps resulting from previous contributions to the performance of the procedure step (e.g. an image processing procedure step interrupted, and completed later).
