Defined Terms: TREATMENT = normal patient treatment OPEN_PORTFILM = portal image acquisition with open field TRMT_PORTFILM = portal image acquisition with treatment port CONTINUATION = continuation of interrupted treatment SETUP = no treatment beam is applied for this RT Beam. To be used for specifying the gantry, couch, and other machine positions where X-Ray set-up images or measurements are to be taken

entry.name: >Treatment Termination Status
entry.description: Conditions under which treatment was terminated. Enumerated Values: NORMAL = treatment terminated normally OPERATOR = operator terminated treatment MACHINE = machine terminated treatment UNKNOWN = status at termination unknown

entry.name: >Treatment Termination Code
entry.description: Treatment machine termination code. This code is dependent upon the particular application and equipment.

entry.name: >Treatment Verification Status
entry.description: Conditions under which treatment was verified by a verification system. Enumerated Values: VERIFIED = treatment verified VERIFIED_OVR = treatment verified with at least one out-of-range value overridden NOT_VERIFIED = treatment verified manually

entry.name: >Specified Primary Meterset
entry.description: Desired machine setting of primary meterset.

entry.name: >Specified Secondary Meterset
entry.description: Desired machine setting of secondary meterset.

entry.name: >Delivered Primary Meterset
entry.description: Machine setting actually delivered as recorded by primary meterset.

entry.name: >Delivered Secondary Meterset
entry.description: Machine setting actually delivered as recorded by secondary meterset.

entry.name: >Specified Treatment Time
entry.description: Treatment Time set (sec).

entry.name: >Delivered Treatment Time
entry.description: Treatment Time actually delivered (sec).

entry.name: >Number of Control Points
entry.description: Number of control points delivered.

entry.name: >Control Point Delivery Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of beam control points for current treatment beam. The sequence may contain one or more items. See C.8.8.21.1.
entry.section: All treatment machine delivery parameters (including table angles and positions) in the RT Treatment Session Record Module shall be specified as absolute, not relative, values at the Control Point.

entry.name: >>Referenced Control Point Index
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Control Point specified by Control Point Index (300A,0112) within Beam referenced by Referenced Beam Number (300C,0006).

entry.name: >>Treatment Control Point Date
entry.description: Date administration of treatment beam began.

entry.name: >>Treatment Control Point Time
entry.description: Time administration of treatment beam began.

entry.name: >>Specified Meterset
entry.description: Desired machine setting for current control point. See C.8.8.21.2.
entry.section: Specified Meterset (3008,0042) contains the MU as specified in the corresponding RT Plan at a given control point. Delivered Meterset (3008,0044) shall contain one of the following three values:

entry.name: >>Delivered Meterset
entry.description: Machine setting actually delivered at current control point. See C.8.8.21.2.
entry.section: Specified Meterset (3008,0042) contains the MU as specified in the corresponding RT Plan at a given control point. Delivered Meterset (3008,0044) shall contain one of the following three values:

entry.name: >>Dose Rate Set
entry.description: Dose Rate set on treatment machine for segment beginning at current control point (meterset/min).

entry.name: >>Dose Rate Delivered
entry.description: Dose Rate actually delivered for segment beginning at current control point (meterset/min).

entry.name: >>Nominal Beam Energy
entry.description: Nominal Beam Energy at control point.

entry.name: >>Nominal Beam Energy Unit
entry.description: Units used for Nominal Beam Energy (300A,0114). Required if Nominal Beam Energy (300A,0114) is sent. Defined Terms: MV = Megavolt MEV = Mega electron-Volt If Radiation Type (300A,00C6) is PHOTON, Nominal Beam Energy Unit (300A,0015) shall be MV. If Radiation Type (300A,00C6) is ELECTRON, Nominal Beam Energy Unit (300A,0015) shall be MEV.

entry.name: >>Wedge Position Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Wedge positions for current control point. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>>Referenced Wedge Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies wedge specified by Wedge Number (300A,00D2) within Beam referenced by Referenced Beam Number (300C,0006). Required if Wedge Position Sequence (300A,0116) is sent.

entry.name: >>>Wedge Position
entry.description: Position of Wedge at current control point. Required if Wedge Position Sequence (300A,0116) is sent. Enumerated Values: IN, OUT.

entry.name: >>Beam Limiting Device Position Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of beam limiting device (collimator) jaw or leaf (element) positions. Required for Control Point 0 of Control Point Delivery Sequence (3008,0040) or if beam limiting device (collimator) changes during beam administration. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>>RT Beam Limiting Device Type
entry.description: Type of beam limiting device. The value of this attribute shall correspond to RT Beam Limiting Device Type (300A,00B8) defined in an element of Beam Limiting Device Leaf Pairs Sequence (3008,00A0). Required if Beam Limiting Device Position Sequence (300A,011A) is sent. Enumerated Values: X = symmetric jaw pair in IEC X direction Y = symmetric jaw pair in IEC Y direction ASYMX = asymmetric jaw pair in IEC X direction ASYMY = asymmetric pair in IEC Y direction MLCX = multileaf (multi-element) jaw pair in IEC X direction MLCY = multileaf (multi-element) jaw pair in IEC Y direction

entry.name: >>>Leaf/Jaw Positions
entry.description: Positions of beam limiting device (collimator) leaf (element) or jaw pairs (mm) in IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate axis appropriate to RT Beam Limiting Device Type (300A,00B8), e.g. X-axis for MLCX, Y-axis for MLCY. Contains 2N values, where N is the Number of Leaf/Jaw Pairs (300A,00BC) defined in element of Beam Limiting Device Leaf Pairs Sequence (3008,00A0). Values shall be in IEC leaf subscript order 101, 102, … 1N, 201, 202 … 2N. Required if Beam Limiting Device Position Sequence (300A,011A) is sent.

entry.name: >>Gantry Angle
entry.description: Treatment machine gantry angle, i.e. orientation of IEC GANTRY coordinate system with respect to IEC FIXED REFERENCE coordinate system (degrees). Required for Control Point 0 of Control Point Delivery Sequence (3008,0040) or if Gantry Angle changes during beam administration.

entry.name: >>Gantry Rotation Direction
entry.description: Direction of Gantry Rotation when viewing gantry from isocenter, for segment beginning at current Control Point. Required for Control Point 0 of Control Point Delivery Sequence (3008,0040), or if Gantry Rotation Direction changes during beam administration. Enumerated Values: CW = clockwise CC = counter-clockwise NONE = no rotation

entry.name: >>Gantry Pitch Angle
entry.description: Gantry Pitch Angle. i.e. the rotation of the IEC GANTRY coordinate system about the X-axis of the IEC GANTRY coordinate system (degrees). If used, must be present for first item of Control Point Sequence, or if used and Gantry Pitch Rotation Angle changes during Beam, must be present. See C.8.8.25.6.5.
entry.section:
The Gantry Pitch angle is not defined in IEC 61217. This angle is defined in the DICOM standard in a way compatible with the current notion of IEC by introducing it as rotation of the IEC GANTRY System as indicated below. The Gantry Pitch Angle is defined as the rotation of the coordinate axes Yg, Zg about axis Xg by an angle g; see Figure C.8.8.25-7. An increase in the value of angle g corresponds to the clockwise rotation as viewed from the isocenter along the positive Xg axis
Figure C.8.8.25-7 Gantry Pitch Angle

entry.name: >>Gantry Pitch Rotation Direction
entry.description: Direction of Gantry Pitch Angle when viewing along the positive X-axis of the IEC GANTRY coordinate system, for segment following Control Point. If used, must be present for first item of Control Point Sequence, or if used and Gantry Pitch Rotation Direction changes during Beam, must be present. See C.8.8.14.8 and C.8.8.25.6.5. Enumerated Values: CW = clockwise CC = counter-clockwise NONE = no rotation
entry.section:
For the machine rotation angles Gantry Angle (300A,011E), Beam Limiting Device Angle (300A,0120), Patient Support Angle (300A,0122) , and Table Top Eccentric Angle (300A,0125), rotation direction is specified as clockwise (CW), counter-clockwise (CC), or NONE. The maximum permitted rotation between two Control Points is 360 degrees. Examples: a) Gantry Angle moves from 5 degrees to 5 degrees, Gantry Rotation Direction = NONE: No movement.
b) Gantry Angle moves from 5 degrees to 5 degrees, Gantry Rotation Direction = CW: Full clockwise rotation (360 degrees).
c) Table Angle moves from 170 degrees to 160 degrees, Table Rotation Direction = CC: Counter-clockwise rotation by 350 degrees (note direction of increasing table angle as defined by IEC 61217).

entry.name: >>Beam Stopper Position
entry.description: Position of Beam Stopper during beam administration. Enumerated Values: EXTENDED = Beam Stopper extended RETRACTED = Beam Stopper retracted UNKNOWN = Position unknown

entry.name: >>Beam Limiting Device Angle
entry.description: Beam Limiting Device (collimator) angle, i.e. orientation of IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate system with respect to IEC GANTRY coordinate system (degrees). Required for Control Point 0 of Control Point Delivery Sequence (3008,0040) or if beam limiting device (collimator) angle changes during beam delivery.

entry.name: >>Beam Limiting Device Rotation Direction
entry.description: Direction of Beam Limiting Device Rotation when viewing beam limiting device (collimator) from radiation source, for segment beginning at current Control Point. Required for Control Point 0 of Control Point Delivery Sequence (3008,0040) or if Beam Limiting Device Rotation Direction changes during beam administration. Enumerated Values: CW = clockwise CC = counter-clockwise NONE = no rotation

entry.name: >>Patient Support Angle
entry.description: Patient Support angle, i.e. orientation of IEC PATIENT SUPPORT (turntable) coordinate system with respect to IEC FIXED REFERENCE coordinate system (degrees). Required for Control Point 0 of Control Point Delivery Sequence (3008,0040) or if Patient Support Angle changes during beam administration.

entry.name: >>Patient Support Rotation Direction
entry.description: Direction of Patient Support Rotation when viewing table from above, for segment beginning at current Control Point. Required for Control Point 0 of Control Point Delivery Sequence (3008,0040), or if Patient Support Rotation Direction changes during beam administration. Enumerated Values: CW = clockwise CC = counter-clockwise NONE = no rotation

entry.name: >>Table Top Eccentric Axis Distance
entry.description: Distance (positive) from the IEC PATIENT SUPPORT vertical axis to the IEC TABLE TOP ECCENTRIC vertical axis (mm).

entry.name: >>Table Top Eccentric Angle
entry.description: Table Top (non-isocentric) angle, i.e. orientation of IEC TABLE TOP ECCENTRIC coordinate system with respect to IEC PATIENT SUPPORT coordinate system (degrees). Required for Control Point 0 of Control Point Delivery Sequence (3008,0040) or if Table Top Eccentric Angle changes during beam administration.

entry.name: >>Table Top Eccentric Rotation Direction
entry.description: Direction of Table Top Eccentric Rotation when viewing table from above, for segment beginning at current Control Point. Required for Control Point 0 of Control Point Delivery Sequence (3008,0040) or if Table Top Eccentric Rotation Direction changes during beam administration. Enumerated Values: CW = clockwise CC = counter-clockwise NONE = no rotation

entry.name: >>Table Top Pitch Angle
entry.description: Table Top Pitch Angle, i.e. the rotation of the IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system about the X-axis of the IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system (degrees). If required by treatment delivery device, shall be present for first item of Control Point Sequence. If required by treatment delivery device and if Table Top Pitch Angle changes during Beam, shall be present in all subsequent items of Control Point Sequence. See C.8.8.25.6.2.
entry.section:
Pitch and Roll Coordinate Systems of the Table Top are not defined in IEC 61217. These angles are defined in the DICOM standard in a way compatible with the current notion of IEC by introducing them as rotations of the IEC Table Top System as indicated below. The Table Top Pitch Angle is defined as the rotation of the coordinate axes Yt, Zt about axis Xt by an angle t; see Figure C.8.8.25-3. An increase in the value of angle t corresponds to the clockwise rotation of the Table Top as viewed from the Table Top coordinate system origin along the positive Xt axis. The Table Top Roll Angle is defined as the rotation of the coordinate axes Xt, Zt about axis Yt by an angle t; see Figure C.8.8.25-4. An increase in the value of angle t corresponds to the clockwise rotation of the Table Top as viewed from the Table Top coordinate system origin along the positive Yt axis.
Figure C.8.8.25-3 Table Top Pitch Angle
Figure C.8.8.25-4 Table Top Roll Angle

entry.name: >> Table Top Pitch Rotation Direction
entry.description: Direction of Table Top Pitch Rotation when viewing the table along the positive X-axis of the IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system, for segment following Control Point. If required by treatment delivery device, shall be present for first item of Control Point Sequence. If required by treatment delivery device and if Table Top Pitch Rotation Direction changes during Beam, shall be present in all subsequent items of Control Point Sequence. See C.8.8.14.8 and C.8.8.25.6.2. Enumerated Values: CW = clockwise CC = counter-clockwise NONE = no rotation
entry.section:
For the machine rotation angles Gantry Angle (300A,011E), Beam Limiting Device Angle (300A,0120), Patient Support Angle (300A,0122) , and Table Top Eccentric Angle (300A,0125), rotation direction is specified as clockwise (CW), counter-clockwise (CC), or NONE. The maximum permitted rotation between two Control Points is 360 degrees. Examples: a) Gantry Angle moves from 5 degrees to 5 degrees, Gantry Rotation Direction = NONE: No movement.
b) Gantry Angle moves from 5 degrees to 5 degrees, Gantry Rotation Direction = CW: Full clockwise rotation (360 degrees).
c) Table Angle moves from 170 degrees to 160 degrees, Table Rotation Direction = CC: Counter-clockwise rotation by 350 degrees (note direction of increasing table angle as defined by IEC 61217).

entry.name: >>Table Top Roll Angle
entry.description: Table Top Roll Angle, i.e. the rotation of the IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system about the IEC Y-axis of the IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system (degrees). If required by treatment delivery device, shall be present for first item of Control Point Sequence. If required by treatment delivery device and if Table Top Roll Angle changes during Beam, shall be present in all subsequent items of Control Point Sequence. See C.8.8.25.6.2.
entry.section:
Pitch and Roll Coordinate Systems of the Table Top are not defined in IEC 61217. These angles are defined in the DICOM standard in a way compatible with the current notion of IEC by introducing them as rotations of the IEC Table Top System as indicated below. The Table Top Pitch Angle is defined as the rotation of the coordinate axes Yt, Zt about axis Xt by an angle t; see Figure C.8.8.25-3. An increase in the value of angle t corresponds to the clockwise rotation of the Table Top as viewed from the Table Top coordinate system origin along the positive Xt axis. The Table Top Roll Angle is defined as the rotation of the coordinate axes Xt, Zt about axis Yt by an angle t; see Figure C.8.8.25-4. An increase in the value of angle t corresponds to the clockwise rotation of the Table Top as viewed from the Table Top coordinate system origin along the positive Yt axis.
Figure C.8.8.25-3 Table Top Pitch Angle
Figure C.8.8.25-4 Table Top Roll Angle

entry.name: >> Table Top Roll Rotation Direction
entry.description: Direction of Table Top Roll Rotation when viewing the table along the positive Y-axis of the IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system, for segment following Control Point. If required by treatment delivery device, shall be present for first item of Control Point Sequence. If required by treatment delivery device and if Table Top Roll Rotation Direction changes during Beam, shall be present in all subsequent items of Control Point Sequence. See C.8.8.14.8 and C.8.8.25.6.2. Enumerated Values: CW = clockwise CC = counter-clockwise NONE = no rotation
entry.section:
For the machine rotation angles Gantry Angle (300A,011E), Beam Limiting Device Angle (300A,0120), Patient Support Angle (300A,0122) , and Table Top Eccentric Angle (300A,0125), rotation direction is specified as clockwise (CW), counter-clockwise (CC), or NONE. The maximum permitted rotation between two Control Points is 360 degrees. Examples: a) Gantry Angle moves from 5 degrees to 5 degrees, Gantry Rotation Direction = NONE: No movement.
b) Gantry Angle moves from 5 degrees to 5 degrees, Gantry Rotation Direction = CW: Full clockwise rotation (360 degrees).
c) Table Angle moves from 170 degrees to 160 degrees, Table Rotation Direction = CC: Counter-clockwise rotation by 350 degrees (note direction of increasing table angle as defined by IEC 61217).

entry.name: >>Table Top Vertical Position
entry.description: Table Top Vertical position in IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system (mm). This value is interpreted as an absolute, rather than relative, Table setting. Required for Control Point 0 of Control Point Delivery Sequence (3008,0040) or if Table Top Vertical Position changes during beam administration.

entry.name: >>Table Top Longitudinal Position
entry.description: Table Top Longitudinal position in IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system (mm). This value is interpreted as an absolute, rather than relative, Table setting. Required for Control Point 0 of Control Point Delivery Sequence (3008,0040) or if Table Top Longitudinal Position changes during beam administration.

entry.name: >>Table Top Lateral Position
entry.description: Table Top Lateral position in IEC TABLE TOP coordinate system (mm). This value is interpreted as an absolute, rather than relative, Table setting. Required for Control Point 0 of Control Point Delivery Sequence (3008,0040) or if Table Top Lateral Position changes during beam administration.

entry.name: >>Corrected Parameter Sequence
entry.description: Introduces a sequence of items describing any corrections made to any attributes prior to delivery of the next control point. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>>Parameter Sequence Pointer
entry.description: Contains the Data Element Tag of the parent sequence containing the attribute that was corrected. The value is limited in scope to the Treatment Session Beam Sequence (3008,0020) and all nested sequences therein.

entry.name: >>>Parameter Item Index
entry.description: Contains the sequence item index (starting at 1) of the corrected attribute within its parent sequence.

entry.name: >>>Parameter Pointer
entry.description: Contains the Data Element Tag of the attribute that was corrected.

entry.name: >>>Correction Value
entry.description: The value applied to the attribute that was referenced by the Parameter Sequence Pointer (3008,0061), Parameter Item Index (3008,0063) and Parameter Pointer (3008,0065).

entry.name: >>Override Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of parameters that were overridden during the administration of the beam segment immediately prior to the current control point. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>>Override Parameter Pointer
entry.description: Contains the Data Element Tag of the attribute that was overridden. Required if Override Sequence (3008,0060) is sent.

entry.name: >>>Parameter Sequence Pointer
entry.description: Contains the Data Element Tag of the parent sequence containing the attribute that was overridden. The value is limited in scope to the Treatment Session Beam Sequence (3008,0020) and all nested sequences therein.

entry.name: >>>Parameter Item Index
entry.description: Contains the sequence item index (monotonically increasing from 1) of the overridden attributes within its parent sequence. The value is limited in scope to the Treatment Session Beam Sequence (3008,0020) and all nested sequences therein.

entry.name: >>>Operators' Name
entry.description: Name of operator who authorized override. Required if Override Sequence (3008,0060) is sent.

entry.name: >>>Override Reason
entry.description: User-defined description of reason for override of parameter specified by Override Parameter Pointer (3008,0062).

module.name: RT Brachy Session Record Module Attributes

entry.name: Operators' Name
entry.description: Name of operator administering treatment session.

entry.name: Referenced Fraction Group Number
entry.description: Identifier of Fraction Group within referenced RT Plan.

entry.name: Number of Fractions Planned
entry.description: Total number of treatments (Fractions) planned for current Fraction Group.

entry.name: Brachy Treatment Technique
entry.description: Type of brachytherapy treatment technique. Enumerated Values: INTRALUMENARY, INTRACAVITARY, INTERSTITIAL, CONTACT, INTRAVASCULAR, PERMANENT. See RT Plan IOD.

entry.name: Brachy Treatment Type
entry.description: Type of brachytherapy treatment. Defined Terms: MANUAL = manually positioned HDR = High dose rate MDR = Medium dose rate LDR = Low dose rate PDR = Pulsed dose rate

entry.name: Recorded Source Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Sources to be used within Application Setups. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >Source Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Source. The value of Source Number (300A,0212) shall be unique within the Recorded Source Sequence (3008,0100) in which it is created.

entry.name: >Source Type
entry.description: Type of Source. Defined Terms: POINT, LINE, CYLINDER, SPHERE.

entry.name: >Source Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of source.

entry.name: >Source Serial Number
entry.description: Serial Number of source.

entry.name: >Source Isotope Name
entry.description: User-defined name of Isotope.

entry.name: >Source Isotope Half Life
entry.description: Half-life of Isotope (days).

entry.name: >Source Strength Units
entry.description: Measurement unit of Source Strength. Required if the source is not a gamma-emitting (photon) source. May be present otherwise. Enumerated Values: AIR_KERMA_RATE = Air Kerma Rate if Source is Gamma emitting Isotope. DOSE_RATE_WATER = Dose Rate in Water if Source is Beta emitting Isotope.

entry.name: >Reference Air Kerma Rate
entry.description: Air Kerma Rate in air of Isotope specified at Air Kerma Rate Reference Date (300A,022C) and Air Kerma Rate Reference Time (300A,022E) (in µGy h-1 at 1 m). Value shall be zero for non-gamma sources.

entry.name: >Source Strength
entry.description: Source Strength of Isotope at Source Strength Reference Date (300A,022C) and Source Strength Reference Time (300A,022E), in units specified in Source Strength Units (300A,0229). Required if the source is not a gamma-emitting (photon) source. See C.8.8.15.13.
entry.section: For beta emitting isotopes, the Source Strength (300A,022B) shall be defined at reference point (r0,θ0), where r0 is the radial distance of 2 mm from the source longitudinal axis, and θ0 is the angle of 90 degrees between the source longitudinal axis and the line defined by the center of the source and the reference point. Refer to: • IEC 60601-2-17 (Medical electrical equipment – Particular requirements for the safety of automatically-controlled brachytherapy afterloading equipment), where the beta source strength is defined as: ABSORBED DOSE RATE [Gy s-1] in water at 2 mm along the perpendicular bisector from a RADIOACTIVE SOURCE emitting beta RADIATION. • Nath et. al.: Intravascular brachytherapy physics: Report of the AAPM Radiation Therapy Committee Task Group No. 60, Med. Phys 26 (2) Feb 1999, pp 119-152.

entry.name: >Source Strength Reference Date
entry.description: Reference date for Reference Air Kerma Rate (300A,022A) or Source Strength (300A,022B) of Isotope.

entry.name: >Source Strength Reference Time
entry.description: Reference time for Air Kerma Rate (300A,022A) or Source Strength (300A,022B) of Isotope.

entry.name: Treatment Session Application Setup Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Application Setups for RT Treatment Record for current RT Plan. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >Application Setup Type
entry.description: Type of Application Setup. Defined Terms: FLETCHER_SUIT, DELCLOS, BLOEDORN, JOSLIN_FLYNN, CHANDIGARH, MANCHESTER, HENSCHKE, NASOPHARYNGEAL, OESOPHAGEAL, ENDOBRONCHIAL, SYED_NEBLETT, ENDORECTAL, PERINEAL.

entry.name: >Referenced Brachy Application Setup Number
entry.description: References application setup specified by Application Setup Number (300A,0234) in Application Setup Sequence (300A,0230) in RT Brachy Applications Module within referenced RT Plan.

entry.name: >Application Setup Name
entry.description: User-defined name for Application Setup.

entry.name: >Application Setup Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of Application Setup.

entry.name: >Template Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Template.

entry.name: >Template Type
entry.description: User-defined type for Template Device.

entry.name: >Template Name
entry.description: User-defined name for Template Device.

entry.name: >Application Setup Check
entry.description: Results of check-wire travel through all channels of current Application Setup. Enumerated Values: PASSED = Passed check FAILED = Failed check UNKNOWN = Unknown status

entry.name: >Referenced Verification Image Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of verification images obtained during delivery of current beam. The sequence may contain one or more items. See Note.

entry.name: >Total Reference Air Kerma
entry.description: Total Reference Air Kerma for current Application Setup, i.e. the sum of the products of the Air Kerma Rates of each Source in each Channel with its respective Channel Time (µGy at 1 m). Value shall be zero for non-gamma sources.

entry.name: >Referenced Measured Dose Reference Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of doses measured during treatment delivery, summed over entire session. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>Referenced Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely references Dose Reference specified by Dose Reference Number (300A,0012) in Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) in RT Prescription Module of referenced RT Plan. Required if Referenced Measured Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0080) is sent and Referenced Measured Dose Reference Number (3008,0082) is not sent. It shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: >>Referenced Measured Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely references Measured Dose Reference specified by Measured Dose Reference Number (3008,0064) in Measured Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0010). Required if Referenced Measured Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0080) is sent and Referenced Dose Reference Number (300C,0051) is not sent. It shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: >>Measured Dose Value
entry.description: Measured Dose in units specified by Dose Units (3004,0002) in sequence referenced by Measured Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0010) or Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) in RT Prescription Module of referenced RT Plan as defined above. Required if Referenced Measured Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0080) is sent.

entry.name: >Referenced Calculated Dose Reference Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of doses estimated for each treatment delivery. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>Referenced Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Dose Reference specified by Dose Reference Number (300A,0012) in Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) in RT Prescription Module of referenced RT Plan. Required if Referenced Calculated Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0090) is sent and Referenced Calculated Dose Reference Number (3008,0092) is not sent. It shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: >>Referenced Calculated Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Calculated Dose Reference specified by Calculated Dose Reference Number (3008,0072) within Calculated Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0070). Required if Referenced Calculated Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0090) is sent and Referenced Dose Reference Number (300C,0051) is not sent. It shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: >>Calculated Dose Reference Dose Value
entry.description: Calculated Dose (Gy). Required if Referenced Calculated Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0090) is sent.

entry.name: >Current Fraction Number
entry.description: Fraction number for this application setup.

entry.name: >Treatment Delivery Type
entry.description: Delivery Type of treatment. Defined Terms: TREATMENT = normal patient treatment CONTINUATION = continuation of interrupted treatment

entry.name: >Treatment Termination Status
entry.description: Conditions under which treatment was terminated. Enumerated Values: NORMAL = treatment terminated normally OPERATOR = operator terminated treatment MACHINE = machine terminated treatment for other than NORMAL condition UNKNOWN = status at termination unknown

entry.name: >Treatment Termination Code
entry.description: Treatment machine termination code. This code is dependent upon the particular application and equipment.

entry.name: >Treatment Verification Status
entry.description: Conditions under which treatment was verified by a verification system. Enumerated Values: VERIFIED = treatment verified VERIFIED_OVR = treatment verified with at least one out-of-range value overridden NOT_VERIFIED = treatment verified manually

entry.name: >Recorded Brachy Accessory Device Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Brachy Accessory Devices associated with current Application Setup. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>Referenced Brachy Accessory Device Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Brachy Accessory Device. The value of Brachy Accessory Device Number (300A,0262) shall be unique within the Application Setup in which it is created. Required if Recorded Brachy Accessory Device Sequence (3008,0120) is sent.

entry.name: >>Brachy Accessory Device ID
entry.description: User or machine supplied identifier for Brachy Accessory Device. Required if Recorded Brachy Accessory Device Sequence (3008,0120) is sent.

entry.name: >>Brachy Accessory Device Type
entry.description: Type of Brachy Accessory Device. Required if Recorded Brachy Accessory Device Sequence (3008,0120) is sent. Defined Terms: SHIELD, DILATATION, MOLD, PLAQUE, FLAB.

entry.name: >>Brachy Accessory Device Name
entry.description: User-defined name for Brachy Accessory Device.

entry.name: >Recorded Channel Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Channels for current Application Setup. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>Channel Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Channel. The value of Channel Number (300A,0282) shall be unique within the Application Setup in which it is created.

entry.name: >>Channel Length
entry.description: Length of Channel (mm). See RT Plan IOD.

entry.name: >>Specified Channel Total Time
entry.description: Total amount of time specified between Control Point 0 and final Control Point of the Brachy Control Point Sequence (300A,02D0) for current Channel (sec).

entry.name: >>Delivered Channel Total Time
entry.description: Total amount of time actually delivered between Control Point 0 and final Control Point of the Brachy Control Point Sequence (300A,02D0) for current Channel (sec).

entry.name: >>Source Movement Type
entry.description: Type of Source movement. Defined Terms: STEPWISE, FIXED, OSCILLATING, UNIDIRECTIONAL.

entry.name: >>Specified Number of Pulses
entry.description: Number of Pulses specified per fraction for current Channel. Required if Brachy Treatment Type (300A,0202) is PDR. See C.8.8.22.1.
entry.section: In Brachytherapy treatment techniques where Brachy Treatment Type (300A,0202) is PDR, the Brachy Control Point Sequence (300A,02D0) shall consist of 2N items, where N = Delivered Number of Pulses (3008,0138). Each control point pair shall specify the start and end of a single pulse.

entry.name: >>Delivered Number of Pulses
entry.description: Number of Pulses actually delivered per fraction for current Channel. Required if Brachy Treatment Type (300A,0202) is PDR. See C.8.8.22.1.
entry.section: In Brachytherapy treatment techniques where Brachy Treatment Type (300A,0202) is PDR, the Brachy Control Point Sequence (300A,02D0) shall consist of 2N items, where N = Delivered Number of Pulses (3008,0138). Each control point pair shall specify the start and end of a single pulse.

entry.name: >>Specified Pulse Repetition Interval
entry.description: Pulse repetition interval (sec) specified for current Channel. Required if Brachy Treatment Type (300A,0202) is PDR. See C.8.8.22.1
entry.section: In Brachytherapy treatment techniques where Brachy Treatment Type (300A,0202) is PDR, the Brachy Control Point Sequence (300A,02D0) shall consist of 2N items, where N = Delivered Number of Pulses (3008,0138). Each control point pair shall specify the start and end of a single pulse.

entry.name: >>Delivered Pulse Repetition Interval
entry.description: Pulse repetition interval (sec) actually delivered for current Channel. Required if Brachy Treatment Type (300A,0202) is PDR. See C.8.8.22.1.
entry.section: In Brachytherapy treatment techniques where Brachy Treatment Type (300A,0202) is PDR, the Brachy Control Point Sequence (300A,02D0) shall consist of 2N items, where N = Delivered Number of Pulses (3008,0138). Each control point pair shall specify the start and end of a single pulse.

entry.name: >>Referenced Measured Dose Reference Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of doses measured during treatment delivery, summed over entire session. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>>Referenced Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely references Dose Reference specified by Dose Reference Number (300A,0012) in Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) in RT Prescription Module of referenced RT Plan. Required if Referenced Measured Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0080) is sent and Referenced Measured Dose Reference Number (3008,0082) is not sent. It shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: >>>Referenced Measured Dose Reference Number
entry.description: References Measured Dose Reference specified by Measured Dose Reference Number (3008,0064) in Measured Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0010). Required if Referenced Measured Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0080) is sent and Referenced Dose Reference Number (300C,0051) is not sent. It shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: >>>Measured Dose Value
entry.description: Measured Dose. Required if Referenced Measured Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0080) is sent.

entry.name: >>Referenced Calculated Dose Reference Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of doses estimated for each treatment delivery. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>>Referenced Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Dose Reference specified by Dose Reference Number (300A,0012) in Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) in RT Prescription Module of referenced RT Plan. Required if Referenced Calculated Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0090) is sent and Referenced Calculated Dose Reference Number (3008,0092) is not sent. It shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: >>>Referenced Calculated Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Calculated Dose Reference specified by Calculated Dose Reference Number (3008,0072) within Calculated Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0070). Required if Referenced Calculated Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0090) is sent and Referenced Dose Reference Number (300C,0051) is not sent. It shall not be present otherwise.

entry.name: >>>Calculated Dose Reference Dose Value
entry.description: Calculated Dose (Gy). Required if Referenced Calculated Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0090) is sent.

entry.name: >>Recorded Source Applicator Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of recorded Source Applicators. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>>Referenced Source Applicator Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Source Applicator. The value of Source Applicator Number (300A,0290) shall be unique within the Channel in which it is created.

entry.name: >>>Source Applicator ID
entry.description: User or machine supplied identifier for Source Applicator. Required if Recorded Source Applicator Sequence (3008,0140) is sent.

entry.name: >>>Source Applicator Type
entry.description: Type of Source Applicator. Required if Recorded Source Applicator Sequence (3008,0140) is sent. Enumerated Values: FLEXIBLE, RIGID.

entry.name: >>>Source Applicator Name
entry.description: User-defined name for Source Applicator.

entry.name: >>>Source Applicator Length
entry.description: Length of Source Applicator (mm), defined as the distance between the connector of the applicator and the distal-most position of the source. Required if Recorded Source Applicator Sequence (3008,0140) is sent.

entry.name: >>>Source Applicator Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of Source Applicator.

entry.name: >>>Source Applicator Step Size
entry.description: Distance of path along channel (mm) between adjacent (potential) dwell positions. Required if Source Movement Type (300A,0288) is STEPWISE.

entry.name: >>Transfer Tube Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Transfer Tube. The value of Transfer Tube Number (300A,02A2) shall be unique within the Channel in which it is created.

entry.name: >>Transfer Tube Length
entry.description: Length of Transfer Tube of current afterloading Channel (mm). Required if value Transfer Tube Number (300A,02A2) is not zero length.

entry.name: >>Recorded Channel Shield Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Channel Shields associated with current Channel. The sequence may contain one or more items. See RT Plan IOD for description of Channel Shields.

entry.name: >>>Referenced Channel Shield Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Channel Shield. The value of Channel Shield Number (300A,02B2) shall be unique within the Channel in which it is created. Required if Recorded Channel Shield Sequence (3008,0150) is sent.

entry.name: >>>Channel Shield ID
entry.description: User or machine supplied identifier for Channel Shield. Required if Recorded Channel Shield Sequence (3008,0150) is sent.

entry.name: >>>Channel Shield Name
entry.description: User-defined name for Channel Shield.

entry.name: >>Referenced Source Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies the referenced Source within the Recorded Source Sequence (3008,0100) for current Application Setup.

entry.name: >>Safe Position Exit Date
entry.description: Date on which the source(s) exited the safe. Required if Recorded Channel Sequence (3008,0130) is sent and Brachy Treatment Type (300A,0202) is not MANUAL.

entry.name: >>Safe Position Exit Time
entry.description: Time on which the source(s) exited the safe. Required if Recorded Channel Sequence (3008,0130) is sent and Brachy Treatment Type (300A,0202) is not MANUAL.

entry.name: >>Safe Position Return Date
entry.description: Date on which the source(s) returned to the safe. Required if Recorded Channel Sequence (3008,0130) is sent and Brachy Treatment Type (300A,0202) is not MANUAL.

entry.name: >>Safe Position Return Time
entry.description: Time on which the source(s) returned to the safe. Required if Recorded Channel Sequence (3008,0130) is sent and Brachy Treatment Type (300A,0202) is not MANUAL.

entry.name: >>Number of Control Points
entry.description: Number of control points in Channel. For an N-segment Channel there will be 2N (stepwise movement) or N+1 (continuous movement) control points.

entry.name: >>Brachy Control Point Delivered Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of machine configurations describing this Channel. The sequence may contain two or more items. See RT Plan IOD and C.8.8.22.1 for description of Brachy Control Point Delivered Sequence.

entry.name: >>>Referenced Control Point Index
entry.description: Index of current Control Point, starting at 0 for first Control Point.

entry.name: >>>Treatment Control Point Date
entry.description: Date when current Control Point occurred.

entry.name: >>>Treatment Control Point Time
entry.description: Time when current Control Point occurred.

entry.name: >>>Control Point Relative Position
entry.description: Distance between current Control Point Position and the distal-most possible Source position in current Channel (mm). See RT Plan IOD.

entry.name: >>>Override Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of parameters which were overridden during the administration of the treatment immediately prior to the current control point. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>>>Override Parameter Pointer
entry.description: Contains the Data Element Tag of the attribute which was overridden. Required if Override Sequence (3008,0060) is sent.

entry.name: >>>>Operators' Name
entry.description: Name of operator who authorized override. Required if Override Sequence (3008,0060) is sent.

entry.name: >>>>Override Reason
entry.description: User-defined description of reason for override of parameter specified by Override Parameter Pointer (3008,0062).

module.name: RT Treatment Summary Record Module Attributes

entry.name: Current Treatment Status
entry.description: Status of the Treatment at the time the Treatment Summary was created. Enumerated Values: NOT_STARTED, ON_TREATMENT, ON_BREAK, SUSPENDED, STOPPED, COMPLETED. See C.8.8.23.1.
entry.section: The definition of the enumerated values for Current Treatment Status (3008,0200) are defined as follows: NOT_STARTED Patient has not yet begun treatment. ON_TREATMENT Patient is currently undergoing treatment. ON_BREAK Patient is currently not undergoing treatment, but a resumption date is known. SUSPENDED Patient is currently not undergoing treatment, but resumption of treatment is planned at an unknown date. STOPPED Patient has stopped treatment without completing the planned course. COMPLETED Patient completed the planned course of treatment. A change in the Current Treatment Status (or any other field) in a RT Treatment Summary Record Object shall define a new instance of the RT Treatment Summary Record IOD.

entry.name: Treatment Status Comment
entry.description: Comment on current treatment status.

entry.name: First Treatment Date
entry.description: Date of delivery of the first treatment.

entry.name: Most Recent Treatment Date
entry.description: Date of delivery of the most recent administration.

entry.name: Fraction Group Summary Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence describing current state of planned vs. delivered fraction groups. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >Referenced Fraction Group Number
entry.description: References Fraction Group Number (300A,0071) in Fraction Group Sequence (300A,0070) in the referenced RT Plan.

entry.name: >Fraction Group Type
entry.description: Indicates type of fraction group. Required if Fraction Group Summary Sequence (3008,0220) is sent. Enumerated Values: EXTERNAL_BEAM, BRACHY.

entry.name: >Number of Fractions Planned
entry.description: Number of fractions planned for this fraction group. Required if Fraction Group Summary Sequence (3008,0220) is sent.

entry.name: >Number of Fractions Delivered
entry.description: Number of fractions delivered as of Treatment Summary Report. Required if Fraction Group Summary Sequence (3008,0220) is sent.

entry.name: >Fraction Status Summary Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence describing status of fractions in Fraction Group. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >>Referenced Fraction Number
entry.description: Identifies fraction. Required if Fraction Status Summary Sequence (3008,0240) is sent.

entry.name: >>Treatment Date
entry.description: Date when fraction was delivered. Required if Fraction Status Summary Sequence (3008,0240) is sent.

entry.name: >>Treatment Time
entry.description: Time when fraction was delivered. Required if Fraction Status Summary Sequence (3008,0240) is sent.

entry.name: >>Treatment Termination Status
entry.description: Conditions under which treatment was terminated. Required if Fraction Status Summary Sequence (3008,0240) is sent. Enumerated Values: NORMAL = treatment terminated normally OPERATOR = operator terminated treatment MACHINE = machine terminated treatment for other than NORMAL condition UNKNOWN = status at termination unknown

entry.name: Treatment Summary Measured Dose Reference Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of references to Measured Dose References. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >Referenced Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Dose Reference specified by Dose Reference Number (300A,0012) in Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) in RT Prescription Module of referenced RT Plan referenced in Referenced RT Plan Sequence (300C,0002) of RT General Treatment Record Module.

entry.name: >Dose Reference Description
entry.description: User-defined description of Dose Reference.

entry.name: >Cumulative Dose to Dose Reference
entry.description: Cumulative Dose delivered to Dose Reference (Gy). Required if Treatment Summary Dose Reference Sequence (3008,00E0) is sent.

entry.name: Treatment Summary Calculated Dose Reference Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of references to Calculated Dose References. The sequence may contain one or more items.

entry.name: >Referenced Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Dose Reference specified by Dose Reference Number (300A,0012) in Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) in RT Prescription Module of referenced RT Plan referenced in Referenced RT Plan Sequence (300C,0002) of RT General Treatment Record Module.

entry.name: >Dose Reference Description
entry.description: User-defined description of Dose Reference.

entry.name: >Cumulative Dose to Dose Reference
entry.description: Cumulative Dose delivered to Dose Reference (Gy). Required if Treatment Summary Dose Reference Sequence (3008,0050) is sent.

module.name: RT Ion Tolerance Tables Module Attributes

entry.name: Ion Tolerance Table Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of ion tolerance tables to be used for delivery of treatment plan. One or more items shall be included in this sequence. See Note 1.

entry.name: >Tolerance Table Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Tolerance Table. The value of Tolerance Table Number (300A,0042) shall be unique within the RT Ion Plan in which it is created.

entry.name: >Tolerance Table Label
entry.description: User-defined label for Tolerance Table.

entry.name: >Gantry Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Gantry Angle.

entry.name: >Beam Limiting Device Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Beam Limiting Device Angle.

entry.name: >Beam Limiting Device Tolerance Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of beam limiting device (collimator) tolerances. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >>RT Beam Limiting Device Type
entry.description: Type of beam limiting device (collimator). Enumerated Values: X = symmetric jaw pair in IEC X direction Y = symmetric jaw pair in IEC Y direction ASYMX = asymmetric jaw pair in IEC X direction ASYMY = asymmetric pair in IEC Y direction MLCX = multileaf (multi-element) jaw pair in IEC X direction MLCY = multileaf (multi-element) jaw pair in IEC Y direction

entry.name: >>Beam Limiting Device Position Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in mm) between planned and delivered leaf (element) or jaw positions for current beam limiting device (collimator).

entry.name: >Patient Support Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Patient Support Angle.

entry.name: >Table Top Vertical Position Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in mm) between planned and delivered Table Top Vertical Position.

entry.name: >Table Top Longitudinal Position Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in mm) between planned and delivered Table Top Longitudinal Position.

entry.name: >Table Top Lateral Position Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in mm) between planned and delivered Table Top Lateral Position.

entry.name: >Table Top Pitch Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Table Top Pitch Angle.

entry.name: >Table Top Roll Angle Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in degrees) between planned and delivered Table Top Roll Angle.

entry.name: >Snout Position Tolerance
entry.description: Maximum permitted difference (in mm) between planned and delivered Snout Position.

entry.name: Ion Beam Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of setup and/or treatment beams for current RT Ion Plan. One or more items shall be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >Beam Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Beam. The value of Beam Number (300A,00C0) shall be unique within the RT Ion Plan in which it is created. See section C.8.8.25.1.

entry.name: >Beam Name
entry.description: User-defined name for Beam. See section C.8.8.25.1.

entry.name: >Beam Description
entry.description: User-defined description for Beam. See section C.8.8.25.1.

entry.name: >Beam Type
entry.description: Motion characteristic of Beam. Enumerated Values: STATIC = all beam parameters remain unchanged during delivery DYNAMIC = one or more beam parameters changes during delivery

entry.name: >Radiation Type
entry.description: Particle type of Beam. Defined Terms: PHOTON PROTON ION

entry.name: >Radiation Mass Number
entry.description: Mass number of radiation. Required if Radiation Type (300A,00C6) is ION

entry.name: >Radiation Atomic Number
entry.description: Atomic number of radiation. Required if Radiation Type (300A,00C6) is ION

entry.name: >Radiation Charge State
entry.description: Charge state of radiation. Required if Radiation Type (300A,00C6) is ION

entry.name: >Scan Mode
entry.description: The method of beam scanning to be used during treatment. Defined Terms: NONE = No beam scanning is performed. UNIFORM = The beam is scanned between control points to create a uniform lateral fluence distribution across the field. MODULATED = The beam is scanned between control points to create a modulated lateral fluence distribution across the field.

entry.name: >Treatment Machine Name
entry.description: User-defined name identifying treatment machine to be used for beam delivery. See section C.8.8.25.2.

entry.name: >Manufacturer
entry.description: Manufacturer of the equipment to be used for beam delivery.

entry.name: >Institution Name
entry.description: Institution where the equipment is located that is to be used for beam delivery.

entry.name: >Institution Address
entry.description: Mailing address of the institution where the equipment is located that is to be used for beam delivery.

entry.name: >Institutional Department Name
entry.description: Department in the institution where the equipment is located that is to be used for beam delivery.

entry.name: >Manufacturer's Model Name
entry.description: Manufacturer's model name of the equipment that is to be used for beam delivery.

entry.name: >Device Serial Number
entry.description: Manufacturer's serial number of the equipment that is to be used for beam delivery.

entry.name: >Primary Dosimeter Unit
entry.description: Measurement unit of machine dosimeter. Enumerated Values: MU = Monitor Unit NP = number of particles

entry.name: >Referenced Tolerance Table Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Tolerance Table specified by Tolerance Table Number (300A,0042) within Tolerance Table Sequence in RT Ion Tolerance Tables Module. These tolerances are to be used for verification of treatment machine settings.

entry.name: >Virtual Source-Axis Distances
entry.description: Distance (in mm) from virtual source position to gantry rotation axis or nominal isocenter position (fixed beam-lines) of the equipment to be used for beam delivery. Specified by a numeric pair - the VSAD in the IEC Gantry X direction followed by the VSAD in the IEC Gantry Y direction. The VSAD is commonly used for designing apertures in contrast to the effective source-axis-distance (ESAD) that is commonly used with the inverse square law for calculating the dose decrease with distance. See section C.8.8.25.4.

entry.name: >Ion Beam Limiting Device Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of beam limiting device (collimator) jaw or leaf (element) sets. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >>RT Beam Limiting Device Type
entry.description: Type of beam limiting device (collimator). Enumerated Values: X = symmetric jaw pair in IEC X direction Y = symmetric jaw pair in IEC Y direction ASYMX = asymmetric jaw pair in IEC X direction ASYMY = asymmetric pair in IEC Y direction MLCX = multileaf (multi-element) jaw pair in IEC X direction MLCY = multileaf (multi-element) jaw pair in IEC Y direction

entry.name: >>Isocenter to Beam Limiting Device Distance
entry.description: Isocenter to beam limiting device (collimator) distance (in mm) of the equipment that is to be used for beam delivery. See section C.8.8.25.4.

entry.name: >>Number of Leaf/Jaw Pairs
entry.description: Number of leaf (element) or jaw pairs (equal to 1 for standard beam limiting device jaws).

entry.name: >>Leaf Position Boundaries
entry.description: Boundaries of beam limiting device (collimator) leaves (in mm) in IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate axis appropriate to RT Beam Limiting Device Type (300A,00B8), i.e. X-axis for MLCY, Y-axis for MLCX. Contains N+1 values, where N is the Number of Leaf/Jaw Pairs (300A,00BC), starting from Leaf (Element) Pair 1. Required if RT Beam Limiting Device Type (300A,00B8) is MLCX or MLCY. See section C.8.8.25.3.

entry.name: >Referenced Patient Setup Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Patient Setup to be used for current beam, specified by Patient Setup Number (300A,0182) within Patient Setup Sequence of RT Patient Setup Module.

entry.name: >Referenced Reference Image Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of reference images used for validation of current beam. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >>Reference Image Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Reference Image within Referenced Reference Image Sequence (300C,0042).

entry.name: >Treatment Delivery Type
entry.description: Delivery Type of treatment. Defined Terms: TREATMENT = normal patient treatment OPEN_PORTFILM = portal image acquisition with open field (the source of radiation is specified by Radiation Type (300A,00C6)) TRMT_PORTFILM = portal image acquisition with treatment port (the source of radiation is specified by Radiation Type (300A,00C6)) CONTINUATION = continuation of interrupted treatment SETUP = no treatment beam is applied for this RT Beam. To be used for specifying the gantry, couch, and other machine positions where X-Ray set-up images or measurements shall be taken.

entry.name: >Referenced Dose Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of related SOP Class/Instance pairs describing related instances of RT Dose (for grids, isodose curves, and named/unnamed point doses). One or more items may be included in this sequence.

include.description: The Referenced Class SOP UID shall be that of the RT Dose SOP Class (1.2.840.10008.5.1.4.1.1.481.2)

entry.name: >Number of Wedges
entry.description: Number of wedges associated with current beam.

entry.name: >Total Wedge Tray Water-Equivalent Thickness
entry.description: Shift of the wedge tray induced on the range of the ion beam as measured in water (in mm).

entry.name: >Ion Wedge Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of treatment wedges. Required if Number of Wedges (300A,00D0) is non-zero. The number of items shall be identical to the value of Number of Wedges (300A,00D0).

entry.name: >>Wedge Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Wedges. The value of Wedge Number (300A,00D2) shall be unique within the Beam in which it was created.

entry.name: >>Wedge Type
entry.description:
Typer of wedge (if any) defined for Beam.
Defined Terms: STANDARD = standard (static) wedge MOTORIZED = single wedge that can be removed from beam remotely. PARTIAL_STANDARD = wedge does not extend across the whole field and is operated manually. PARTIAL_MOTORIZ = wedge does not extend across the whole field and can be removed from beam remotely.

entry.name: >>Wedge ID
entry.description: User-supplied identifier for Wedge.

entry.name: >>Accessory Code
entry.description: An accessory identifier to be read by a device such as a bar code reader.

entry.name: >>Wedge Angle
entry.description: Nominal wedge angle (degrees).

entry.name: >>Wedge Orientation
entry.description: Orientation of wedge, i.e. orientation of IEC WEDGE FILTER coordinate system with respect to the IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate systems (degrees).

entry.name: >>Isocenter to Wedge Tray Distance
entry.description: Isocenter to downstream edge of wedge tray (mm). See section C.8.8.25.4

entry.name: >Number of Compensators
entry.description: Number of compensators associated with current Beam.

entry.name: >Total Compensator Tray Water-Equivalent Thickness
entry.description: Water-Equivalent thickness of the compensator tray (in mm) parallel to radiation beam axis.

entry.name: >Ion Range Compensator Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of compensators. Required if Number of Compensators (300A,00E0) is non-zero. The number of items shall be identical to the value of Number of Compensators (300A,00E0).

entry.name: >>Compensator Description
entry.description: User defined description for the compensator.

entry.name: >>Compensator Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Compensator. The value of Compensator Number (300A,00E4) shall be unique within the Beam in which it is created.

entry.name: >>Material ID
entry.description: User-supplied identifier for material used to manufacture Compensator.

entry.name: >>Compensator ID
entry.description: User-supplied identifier for the compensator.

entry.name: >>Accessory Code
entry.description: An accessory identifier to be read by a device such as a bar code reader.

entry.name: >>Isocenter to Compensator Tray Distance
entry.description: Isocenter to compensator tray attachment edge distance (in mm) for current range compensator. Required if Compensator Mounting Position (300A,02E1) is not DOUBLE_SIDED. See section C.8.8.25.4

entry.name: >>Compensator Divergence
entry.description: Indicates presence or absence of geometrical divergence of the range compensator. Enumerated Values: PRESENT = the range compensator is shaped according to the beam geometrical divergence. ABSENT = the range compensator is not shaped according to the beam geometrical divergence.

entry.name: >>Compensator Mounting Position
entry.description: Indicates on which side of the Compensator Tray the compensator is mounted. Enumerated Values: PATIENT_SIDE = the Compensator is mounted on the side of the Compensator Tray that is towards the patient. SOURCE_SIDE = the Compensator is mounted on the side of the Compensator Tray that is towards the radiation source. DOUBLE_SIDED = the Compensator has a shaped (i.e. non-flat) surface on both sides of the Compensator Tray.

entry.name: >>Compensator Rows
entry.description: Number of rows in the range compensator. A row is defined to be in the X direction of the IEC Beam Limiting Device Coordinate system.

entry.name: >>Compensator Columns
entry.description: Number of columns in the range compensator. A column is defined to be in the Y direction of the IEC Beam Limiting Device Coordinate system.

entry.name: >>Compensator Pixel Spacing
entry.description: Physical distance (in mm) between the center of each pixel projected onto machine isocentric plane. Specified by a numeric pair - adjacent row spacing followed by adjacent column spacing. See 10.7.1.3 for further explanation of the value order.

entry.name: >>Compensator Position
entry.description: The x and y coordinates of the upper left hand corner (first pixel transmitted) of the range compensator, projected onto the machine isocentric plane in the IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate system (mm).

entry.name: >>Compensator Column Offset
entry.description: The offset distance (in mm) applied to the x coordinate of the Compensator Position (300A,00EA) for even numbered rows. Required if the compensator pattern is hexogonal.

entry.name: >>Compensator Thickness Data
entry.description: A data stream of the pixel samples that comprise the range compensator, expressed as physical thickness (in mm), either parallel to radiation beam axis if Compensator Divergence (300A,02E0) equals ABSENT, or divergent according to the beam geometrical divergence if Compensator Divergence (300A,02E0) equals PRESENT. The order of pixels sent is left to right, top to bottom (upper left pixel, followed by the remainder of row 1, followed by the remainder of the rows).

entry.name: >>Isocenter to Compensator Distances
entry.description: A data stream of the pixel samples that comprise the distance from the isocenter to the compensator surface closest to the radiation source (in mm). The order of pixels sent is left to right, top to bottom (upper left pixel, followed by the remainder of row 1, followed by the remainder of the rows). Required if Material ID (300A,00E1) is non-zero length, and Compensator Mounting Position (300A,02E1) is DOUBLE_SIDED. See sections C.8.8.14.9 and C.8.8.25.4

entry.name: >>Compensator Relative Stopping Power Ratio
entry.description: Compensator Linear Stopping Power Ratio, relative to water, at the beam energy specified by the Nominal Beam Energy (300A,0114) of the first Control Point of the Ion Control Point Sequence (300A,03A8).

entry.name: >>Compensator Milling Tool Diameter
entry.description: The diameter (in mm) of the milling tool to be used to create the compensator. The diameter is expressed as the actual physcial size and not a projected size at isocenter.

entry.name: >Number of Boli
entry.description: Number of boli associated with current Beam.

entry.name: >Referenced Bolus Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of boli associated with Beam. Required if Number of Boli (300A,00ED) is non-zero. The number of items shall be identical to the value of Number of Boli (300A,00ED).

entry.name: >>Referenced ROI Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies ROI representing the Bolus specified by ROI Number (3006,0022) in Structure Set ROI Sequence (3006,0020) in Structure Set Module within RT Structure Set in Referenced Structure Set Sequence (300C,0060) in RT General Plan Module.

entry.name: >>Accessory Code
entry.description: An accessory identifier to be read by a device such as a bar code reader.

entry.name: >Number of Blocks
entry.description: Number of shielding blocks associated with Beam.

entry.name: >Total Block Tray Water-Equivalent Thickness
entry.description: Water-Equivalent thickness of the block tray (in mm) parallel to radiation beam axis.

entry.name: >Ion Block Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of blocks associated with Beam. Required if Number of Blocks (300A,00F0) is non-zero. The number of items shall be identical to the value of Number of Blocks (300A,00F0).

entry.name: >>Block Tray ID
entry.description: User-supplied identifier for block tray.

entry.name: >>Accessory Code
entry.description: An accessory identifier to be read by a device such as a bar code reader.

entry.name: >>Isocenter to Block Tray Distance
entry.description: Isocenter to downstream edge of block tray (mm). See section C.8.8.25.4

entry.name: >>Block Type
entry.description: Type of block. See section C.8.8.14.4. Enumerated Values: SHIELDING = blocking material is inside contour APERTURE = blocking material is outside contour

entry.name: >>Block Divergence
entry.description: Indicates presence or otherwise of geometrical divergence. Enumerated Values: PRESENT = block edges are shaped for beam divergence ABSENT = block edges are not shaped for beam divergence

entry.name: >>Block Mounting Position
entry.description: Indicates on which side of the Block Tray the block is mounted. Enumerated Values; PATIENT_SIDE = the block is mounted on the side of the Block Tray that is towards the patient. SOURCE_SIDE = the block is mounted on the side of the Block Tray that is towards the radiation source.

entry.name: >>Block Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Block. The value of Block Number (300A,00FC) shall be unique within the Beam in which it is created.

entry.name: >>Block Name
entry.description: User-defined name for block.

entry.name: >>Material ID
entry.description: User-supplied identifier for material used to manufacture Block.

entry.name: >>Block Thickness
entry.description: Physical thickness of block (in mm) parallel to radiation beam axis. See section C.8.8.14.4.

entry.name: >>Block Number of Points
entry.description: Number of (x,y) pairs defining the block edge.

entry.name: >>Block Data
entry.description: A data stream of (x,y) pairs that comprise the block edge. The number of pairs shall be equal to Block Number of Points (300A,0104), and the vertices shall be interpreted as a closed polygon. Coordinates are projected onto the machine isocentric plane in the IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE coordinate system (mm).

entry.name: >Snout Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Snouts associated with Beam. Only a single item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >>Snout ID
entry.description: User or machine supplied identifier for Snout.

entry.name: >>Accessory Code
entry.description: An accessory identifier to be read by a device such as a bar code reader.

entry.name: >Applicator Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Applicators associated with Beam. Only a single item shall be permitted in this sequence.

entry.name: >>Applicator ID
entry.description: User or machine supplied identifier for Applicator. See section C.8.8.14.12

entry.name: >>Accessory Code
entry.description: An accessory identifier to be read by a device such as a bar code reader.

entry.name: >>Applicator Type
entry.description:
Type of applicator.
Defined Terms: ION_SQUARE = square ion applicator ION_RECT = rectangluar ion applicator ION_CIRC = circular ion applicator ION_SHORT = short ion applicator ION_OPEN = open (dummy) ion applicator INTEROPERATIVE = interoperative (custom) applicator STEREOTACTIC = stereotactic applicator

entry.name: >>Applicator Description
entry.description: User-defined description for Applicator.

entry.name: >General Accessory Sequence
entry.description: Introduces a Sequence of General Accessories associated with this Beam. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >>General Accessory Number
entry.description: Identification Number of the General Accessory. The value shall be unique within the sequence.

entry.name: >>General Accessory ID
entry.description: User or machine supplied identifier for General Accessory.

entry.name: >>General Accessory Description
entry.description: User supplied description of General Accessory.

entry.name: >>General Accessory Type
entry.description: Specifies the type of accessory. Defined Terms: GRATICULE = Accessory tray with a radio-opaque grid IMAGE_DETECTOR = Image acquisition device positioned in the beam line RETICLE = Accessory tray with radio-transparent markers or grid

entry.name: >>Accessory Code
entry.description: Machine-readable identifier for this accessory

entry.name: >Number of Range Shifters
entry.description: Number of range shifters associated with current beam.

entry.name: >Range Shifter Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of range shifters associated with Beam. Required if Number of Range Shifters (300A,0312) is non-zero. The number of items shall be identical to the value of Number of Range Shifters (300A,0312).

entry.name: >>Range Shifter Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Range Shifter. The value of Range Shifter Number (300A,0316) shall be unique within the Beam in which it is created.

entry.name: >>Range Shifter ID
entry.description: User or machine supplied identifier for Range Shifter.

entry.name: >>Accessory Code
entry.description: An accessory identifier to be read by a device such as a bar code reader.

entry.name: >>Range Shifter Type
entry.description: Type of Range Shifter. Defined Terms: ANALOG = Device is variable thickness and is composed of opposing sliding wedges, water column or similar mechanism. BINARY = Device is composed of different thickness materials that can be moved in or out of the beam in various stepped combinations.

entry.name: >>Range Shifter Description
entry.description: User defined description of Range Shifter.

entry.name: >Number of Lateral Spreading Devices
entry.description: Number of lateral spreading devices associated with current beam.

entry.name: >Lateral Spreading Device Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of lateral spreading devices associated with Beam. Required if Number of Lateral Spreading Devices (300A,0330) is non-zero. The number of items shall be identical to the value of Number of Lateral Spreading Devices (300A,0330).

entry.name: >>Lateral Spreading Device Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Lateral Spreading Device. The value of Lateral Spreading Device Number (300A,0334) shall be unique within the Beam in which it is created.

entry.name: >>Lateral Spreading Device ID
entry.description: User or machine supplied identifier for Lateral Spreading Device.

entry.name: >>Accessory Code
entry.description: An accessory identifier to be read by a device such as a bar code reader.

entry.name: >>Lateral Spreading Device Type
entry.description: Type of Lateral Spreading Device. Defined Terms: SCATTERER = metal placed into the beam path to scatter charged particles laterally. MAGNET = nozzle configuration of magnet devices to expand beam laterally.

entry.name: >>Lateral Spreading Device Description
entry.description: User-defined description for lateral spreading device.

entry.name: >Number of Range Modulators
entry.description: Number of range modulators associated with current beam.

entry.name: >Range Modulator Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of range modulators associated with Beam. Required if Number of Range Modulators (300A,0340) is non-zero. The number of items shall be identical to the value of Number of Range Modulators (300A,0340).

entry.name: >>Range Modulator Number
entry.description: Identification number of the Range Modulator. The value of Range Modulator Number (300A,0344) shall be unique within the Beam in which it is created.

entry.name: >>Range Modulator ID
entry.description: User or machine supplied identifier for Range Modulator.

entry.name: >>Accessory Code
entry.description: An accessory identifier to be read by a device such as a bar code reader.

entry.name: >>Range Modulator Type
entry.description: Type of Range Modulator. Defined Terms: FIXED = fixed modulation width and weights using ridge filter or constant speed wheel with constant beam current WHL_FIXEDWEIGHTS = selected wheel/track (Range Modulator ID) is spinning at constant speed. Modulation width is adjusted by switching constant beam current on and off at wheel steps indicated by Range Modulator Gating Values. WHL_MODWEIGHTS = selected wheel/track (Range Modulator ID) is spinning at constant speed. Weight per wheel step is adjusted by modulating beam current according to selected Beam Current Modulation ID (300A,034C). Only one item in the Range Modulator Sequence (300A,0342) can have a Range Modulator Type (300A,0348) of WHL_MODWEIGHTS.

entry.name: >>Range Modulator Description
entry.description: User-defined description of Range Modulator.

entry.name: >>Beam Current Modulation ID
entry.description: User-supplied identifier for the beam current modulation pattern. Required if Range Modulator Type (300A,0348) is WHL_MODWEIGHTS

include.ref: >Include Patient Support Identification Macro Table C.8.8.28-1

entry.name: >Fixation Light Azimuthal Angle
entry.description: Azimuthal angle (degrees) of the fixation light coordinate around IEC BEAM LIMITING DEVICE Y-axis. Used for eye treatments. See section C.8.8.25.6.4.

entry.name: >Fixation Light Polar Angle
entry.description: Polar angle (degrees) of the fixation light coordinate. Used for eye treatments. See section C.8.8.25.6.4.

entry.name: >Final Cumulative Meterset Weight
entry.description: Value of Cumulative Meterset Weight (300A,0134) for final Control Point in Ion Control Point Sequence (300A,03A8). Required if Cumulative Meterset Weight is non-null in Control Points specified within Ion Control Point Sequence. See section C.8.8.14.1.

entry.name: >Number of Control Points
entry.description: Number of control points in Beam. Value shall be greater than or equal to 2.

entry.name: >Ion Control Point Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of machine configurations describing Ion treatment beam. The number of items shall be identical to the value of Number of Control Points (300A,0110). See C.8.8.25.7.
entry.section: The control point sequence for RT Ion Beams is defined using the same rule set as in the RT Beams module (see Section C.8.8.14.5 Control Point Sequence). Specifically, the following rules apply:

entry.name: >>Control Point Index
entry.description: Index of current Control Point, starting at 0 for first Control Point.

entry.name: >>Cumulative Meterset Weight
entry.description: Cumulative weight to current control point. Cumulative Meterset Weight for the first item in Control Point Sequence shall always be zero. Cumulative Meterset Weight for the final item in Ion Control Point Sequence shall always be equal to Final Cumulative Meterset Weight.

entry.name: >>Referenced Dose Reference Sequence
entry.description: Introduces a sequence of Dose References for current Beam. One or more items may be included in this sequence.

entry.name: >>>Referenced Dose Reference Number
entry.description: Uniquely identifies Dose Reference specified by Dose Reference Number (300A,0012) in Dose Reference Sequence (300A,0010) in RT Prescription Module.

entry.name: >>>Cumulative Dose Reference Coefficient
entry.description: Coefficient used to calculate cumulative dose contribution from this Beam to the referenced Dose Reference at the current Control Point.

entry.name: >>Nominal Beam Energy
entry.description: Nominal Beam Energy at control point in MeV per nucleon. Defined at nozzle entrance before all Beam Modifiers. Required for first item of Control Point Sequence, or if Nominal Beam Energy changes during Beam, and KVp (0018,0060) is not present.

entry.name: >>KVp
entry.description: Peak kilo voltage output of the setup X-Ray generator to be used. Required for first item of Control Point Sequence, or if KVp changes during setup, and Nominal Beam Energy (300A,0114) is not present.

entry.name: >>Meterset Rate
entry.description: Specifies the speed of delivery of the specified dose in units specified by Primary Dosimeter Unit (300A,00B3) per minute.

entry.name: >>Ion Wedge Position Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Wedge positions for current control point. Required for first item of Ion Control Point Sequence if Number of Wedges (300A,00D0) is non-zero, and in subsequent control points if Wedge Position (300A,0118) or Wedge Thin Edge Position (300A,00DB) changes during beam. The number of items shall be identical to the value of Number of Wedges (300A,00D0).

entry.name: >>>Referenced Wedge Number
entry.description: Uniquely references Wedge described by Wedge Number (300A,00D2) in Wedge Sequence (300A,00D1).

entry.name: >>>Wedge Position
entry.description: Position of Wedge at current Control Point. Enumerated Values: IN OUT

entry.name: >>>Wedge Thin Edge Position
entry.description: Closest distance from the central axis of the beam along a wedge axis to the thin edge as projected to the machine isocentric plane (mm). Value is positive is the wedge does not cover the central axis, negative if it does. Required if Wedge Type (300A,00D3) of the wedge referenced by Referenced Wedge Number (300C,00C0) is PARTIAL_STANDARD or PARTIAL_MOTORIZ. See section C.8.8.25.6.4.

entry.name: >>Range Shifter Settings Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Range Shifter settings for the current control point. One or more items shall be included in this sequence. Required for first item of Control Point Sequence if Number of Range Shifters (300A,0312) is non-zero, or if Range Shifter Setting (300A,0362) changes during Beam.

entry.name: >>>Referenced Range Shifter Number
entry.description: Uniquely references Range Shifter described by Range Shifter Number (300A,0316) in Range Shifter Sequence (300A,0314).

entry.name: >>>Range Shifter Setting
entry.description: Machine specific setting attribute for the range shifter. The specific encoding of this value should be documented in a Conformance Statement. See section C.8.8.25.5.

entry.name: >>>Isocenter to Range Shiffter Distance
entry.description: Isocenter to downstream edge of range shifter (mm) at current control point. See section C.8.8.25.4

entry.name: >>>Range Shifter Water Equivalent Thickness
entry.description: Water equivalent thickness (in mm) of the range shifter at the central axis for the beam energy incident upon the device.

entry.name: >>Lateral Spreading Device Settings Sequence
entry.description: Introduces sequence of Lateral Spreading Device settings for the current control point. One or more items shall be included in this sequence. Required for first item of Control Point Sequence if Number of Lateral Spreading Devices (300A,0330) is non-zero, or if Lateral Spreading Device Setting (300A,0372) changes during Beam.

entry.name: >>>Referenced Lateral Spreading Device Number
entry.description: Uniquely references Lateral Spreading Device described by Lateral Spreading Device Number (300A,0334) in Lateral Spreading Device Sequence (300A,0332).

entry.name: >>>Lateral Spreading Device Setting
entry.description: Machine specific setting attribute for the lateral spreading device. The specific encoding of this value should be documented in a Conformance Statement. See section C.8.8.25.5.
